Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: MezSolihull
Reviews.Content: Very good location with water us stop right outside. Hotel staff excellent, very friendly and nothing too much trouble, all English speaking which helped! Room was fabulous, very weel appointed, beautiful, large en-suite, all very clean. Turn down service and clean hand towels in the evening a bonus we weren't expecting. I visited Venice with my mother who is almost 80 and this hotel was ideally located for sightseeing. Breakfast brilliant, great choices and lots of it! Would definitely visit again. Venice has to be on everyone's places to visit list!

Reviews.Title: “Just great!”
Reviews.Author: 3Muir2011
Reviews.Content: An excellent location...waterbus stops directly outside hotel making the journey very easy (15 euros pp from airport to hotel-excellent way to see the numerous boats and land views!) , close to many attractions and restaurants. Friendly staff, comfortable room albeit small but clean and newly decorated. Bathroom a good size, modern and new, fresh linen daily and towels changed twice daily. A good range of breakfast to suit all tastes. All in all we couldn't have asked for more-for a 3 night break- will definately return!

Reviews.Title: “Great food near to St Mark's square”
Reviews.Author: solotravellerBedford
Reviews.Content: I did not stay at this hotel, but I did have lunch here on three occasions. Each time the food was delicious and the service was second to none. If you want a good reasonably priced meal or snack near to St Mark's then this is the place. Also a good location overlooking the lagoon.

Reviews.Title: “Panoramic View of Grand Canal”
Reviews.Author: yeeha
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights. Our room with a view. Very pleasant hosts. Lifts for 2 persons only Clean rooms worthy of 3 stars.Best seafood soup in town. Doorsteps from San Marco. Venice is unique and a city to visit before you die. Bring along a PFD - personal floatation device if you cannot swim.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and Value”
Reviews.Author: Chris M
Reviews.Content: We went for our wedding anniversary through a deal with Citalia at the end of February for 4 days. The weather was perfect which always helps. The first decision at the airport was waterbus or water taxi, we chose the waterbus which was cheaper and slower. On reflection we should have entered Venice on a water taxi, as we could have gone down the Grand Canal and returned on the waterbus. The Hotel is right opposite the waterbus stop so no lugging on suitcases. The hotel fronts the canal at the start of the Grand Canal and is only 5 minute leisurely walk from St Marks Square. We were welcomed by attentive staff and shown to our standard room, the deal did not include a canal view, although you could see it if you hung out the window! We selected the half board option which was one way to control the cost of eating out but in hindsight it was a bit unnecessary. Our room was very well appointed with a lovely bathroom, comfortable bed and a safe. Hotel breakfast was excellent and one day we swopped dinner for lunch and sat outside overlooking the water, superb. The hotel is a great place to explore from (and easy o find if lost!). Only downside was that the hotel did not have its own bar so any nightcap had to be taken in one of the hundreds of bars close by. A very enjoyable break made better by a very good hotel in a suberb location. Would recommend..

Reviews.Title: “I,VE BEEN BACK AGAIN!”
Reviews.Author: maureendavies55
Reviews.Content: i just love this hotel having visited on many occasions but i am never dissapointed with the service at this hotel.the location is wonderful very close to st.marks.square.i usually visit with my daughter but on my last visit i took my husband who was very impressed and on this occasion i stayed with my my daughter and husband the experience was lovely .the staff are very helpful and always treat us like friends i,ve already booked to go back in july to see the redentore fireworks festival so that says it all!

Reviews.Title: “The best view in Venice”
Reviews.Author: feb77
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights in the middle of our honeymoon. Having spent the first four days at Lake Como, we hired campervan and toured around rural Tuscany for a week. Although we had a great time, we were really looking forward to a bit more luxury. Savoia & Jolanda didnâ€™t disappoint! We stayed in the junior suite (was immediately above the lettering on the front of the hotel) which had a double balcony overlooking the lagoon. I really think youâ€™d struggle for a better view in Venice! By suite standards the room wasnâ€™t terribly big, but perfectly adequate and very clean. The reception staff were very efficient and helpful. Breakfast is a bit of a free for all and the selection isnâ€™t huge, but perfectly adequate. The hotel location couldnâ€™t be better. It is literally a 2 minute walk to St Marks Square, although from the front door of the hotel youâ€™re straight into the tourist hoards. There is a Vaparetto stop right outside the front door too, as well as a stack of gondolas. In only two days we fell in love with Venice and Savoia & Jolanda provided the perfect base to discover this beautiful and unique city.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location hotel”
Reviews.Author: Aja-Boutique
Reviews.Content: Second time stay in this hotel during Venice Carnaval. Clasic style hotel is located on a Grand canal, in front of water taxi station, wich has direct connection to bus station in Mestre. Few steps away from St. Marco.The best location for reasonable price. Profesional, helpfull staff.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect city break hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mia_Khan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Savoia & Jolanda for 3 nights during the carnival and for Valentines day. Location of the hotel is great, as soon as you step off the vaporetto at San Zaccaria (make sure you get the water bus/vaporetto for 15 euros each unless you want to pay 100 euros for the private water taxi) the hotel is right in front of you and only 3 minutes walk to San Marco square. Check-in was swift and the staff were polite and helpful and spoke good English. The bell-boy took us up to our room and explained about breakfast times etc. and that we were staying in a newly refurbished part of the hotel. Make sure you have some change to give to him as at that point we only had cash to give him! The room was small but beautifully decorated in Venetian style and a lovely bathroom with walk-in shower. It was clean with a fully stocked mini bar, tv and all the other amenities you would need. The bed was large and comfortable. Breakfast was served till 10am but the service could be a little slow at times. Good coffee and a decent continental breakfast, nothing spectacular but we enjoyed it. Concierge were helpful in giving us a recommendation for a traditional Pizzeria. Only downsides to this hotel was the noise very early in the morning from outside (our room just looked out to a street at the back of the hotel) and the walls weren't very soundproof if you catch our drift!! Overall a lovely stay for a city break, if you want something a little bit special, we would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Frustrating experience, but I know it was luck of the draw”
Reviews.Author: gmjpeach
Reviews.Content: Traveled Dec. 2010. I booked this hotel for my honeymoon, and did so last minute. As a travel agent, I have sent many people here, so when my tour package got canceled at the last minute, I booked here. The price was amazing, $150 per night with breakfast for a run of house room, and right before we arrived, the flooding cleared, and we were psyched to see our that this hotel was in the best position! When we arrived, the lobby was lovely. The man at the front desk was a little put offish, but we were excited to finally be in our last honeymoon stay in Venice, so no big. The problem was when we got to our room. The room was surprisingly spacious but sparsely appointed, and the bathroom seemed renovated. I went to the window to open the curtains, only to find scaffolding and four workmen, one of whom waved to me. They workman then proceeded to hammer, bang, and generally work. Did I mention this was the last stay on our honeymoon where we were going to relax in room before going home? There was NO WAY. I called the front desk, and the surly man there explained to me that they would only be doing this for the next hour. I told him I didn't care, I want to move. 45 minutes later, a nicer guy came to help us move to the next place. The front desk man was there the next three days, giving us looks every time we walked by. The one time we wanted to ask a question about where to eat, he picked up the phone and stayed on it for over 10 minutes, until we finally walked away. The line about the construction only being the next hour was a total lie, and continued through the rest of our stay, starting at about 8am. So why still such a high review? First, we were in the super low season, and I would have been surprised if there was more than 15 rooms filled, and the construction was pretty minor. Plus, the price that I paid was super low, and the room type was "run of house" which means you could get anything. And they did move us. The breakfast was HANDS DOWN the best part of our stay. It was incredible, with everything you could possibly want, and their restaurant was VERY impressive. I also had positive experiences with all other staffers EXCEPT the front desk guy, so I am not going to let one stinker say it was horrible. The bed was ok, not super comfortable, and my sleep quality was impacted by the morning noise and the just ok bed quality. Had it been no noise or construction, I would have been satisfied. Would I stay here again? Yes, but I would specify at check in that I wanted a quiet room.

Reviews.Title: “Overlooking the Riva degli schiavoni in Venice !”
Reviews.Author: giorgiadettoni
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with an impeccable location, once you arrive via vaporetto you are at your hotel!! No stairs no dragging suitcases over bridges.. Fantastic! The hotel was lovely, the staff were very helpful and very happy to assist. Only draw back was that the restaurant closed rather early in the evenings, 8:30 pm it was all over.. But everything else was tops. I would stay here again, lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sandra1birmingham
Reviews.Content: We were booked to stay around the corner at the Villa Igea , but I imagine due to low occupancy were put in this hotel last week. The staff were all so helpful and polite, linen changed daily in our room.Decor of the room typical Venetian. Located near to water buses and water taxis - right outside the front entrance and only a short walk to the main sights- perfect. We came into Treviso airport and was easy to catch the bus outside of the arrivals hall for the 40 minute journey to the main Piazza Roma on Venice, then a short journey by water bus to our hotel. Would recommend this method to get to hotel, dont bother booking a more expensive prebookable "Meet and Greet" type taxi is just isnt worth it. Helpful Hints - there was a hairdryer in the room at the hotel so dont bother to take one, buy a "pass" for your water bus rides otherwise one journey is 6.50 euros for a single journey regardless of length, expensive if only going a couple of stops. Watch the prices if going for a coffee prices ranged from 2 to 9 euros for a basic coffee! Venice was every bit as good and magical as I thought it would be!

Reviews.Title: “You just can't miss here”
Reviews.Author: LetsGetOut
Reviews.Content: In the middle of everthing. St. Marks, Museums, anf fine restarants. I really believe I could spend the rest of my life in this most beautiful city. The hotel and staff are magnificent. We have stayed there on two separate trips now and look forward to the third soon. My wife just loves to get lost waling the canals and alleways. Wonderful breakfast at the hotel as well. Steps away fro the San Zaccaria vaparetto stop.

Reviews.Title: “Great all the way around”
Reviews.Author: Travelers0205
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights in October 2011. Wonderful location- very central. Staff was very helpful. Breakfast was great - room was bigger than what we expected. All around a wonderful place to start our Italian experience!

Reviews.Title: “MAGICAL!!!”
Reviews.Author: TexMargo
Reviews.Content: We arrived via Water Taxi early evening Nov 25th after flying on 4 separate flights from Sacramento to Rome to Venice. It was just getting dark and the view from the Water Taxi was beautiful. We were let off on a dock directly in front of The Savoia & Jolanda. Our room was magnificent! The Blue Room top floor, Three balconies!!! We were treated the Royalty for our 25th Anniversary! A Bottle of sparking wine, chocolates, confettii and warm wishes greeted us as we looked out over the lagoon and saw the Beautiful City of Venice for the first time! The staff is friendly and helpfull, our suite was spacious and very clean. We did what one is supposed to, get off the beaten path and discover (and get lost) in the back streets of Venice. I wished we could have stayed for ever! The gondolas are right across from the front enterance of the hotel but we recommend going back in a few vias from the left of the front door and catch a gondola along the canals. We took our ride in the early evening thru dark. Wonderful, eerily quiet and magnificent! Definitely going back soon!

Reviews.Title: “had booked a room with a view, but the view we had was of an alley.”
Reviews.Author: Jane J
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 Nights .... GREAT LOCATION. Booked a ROOM WITH A VIEW, but the view we got was that of an ALLEY!!! They gave our room to ANOTHER GUEST!!!! Our room was booked and payed for in advance.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Remlapm
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights,.. good location on Grand Canal. Lobby is inviting, I had a room with a king size bed, but it was not a large room. For the money, I feel they should update their rooms a bit. The finer hotels don't have nasty bedspreads any longer, and the cloth velvet embossed wallpaper does not allow the room to have a 'fresh'smell. The TV got maybe 5 channels. I understand one does not go to Venice to watch TV, however after a day of touring, it's nice to relax and turn the TV on. In a day where satellite TV is everywhere and affordable, this could be put on the list of "things to update". All in all, I can recommend if you just need a nice place to stay for a few...Staff was very friendly and helpful, no complaints there...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: delphi927
Reviews.Content: A very short walk (less than 2 minutes) to St. Marks square and a vaporetti stop right outside are two huge bonuses for this hotel. The rooms are clean and well sized and the hotel restaurant is surprisingly good. The staff, however, is not the friendliest.

Reviews.Title: “Not 4 Star!”
Reviews.Author: tcsunbounce
Reviews.Content: Although our room was not as booked and the hotel moved us to a better room, the service in this hotel is very curt - even by Venice standards. The location is excellent; on the Grand Canal, just five buildings down, towards The Arsenale, from St. Mark's Square. Breakfast is nowhere near the sumptuous level expected from a 4* European hotel, with the only hot option being scrambled eggs (congealed) and bacon (cold). A member of staff tried the old the con trick of a free boat ride to Morano to see glass blowing - with a factory visit, of course!

Reviews.Title: “can,t wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: maureendavies55
Reviews.Content: this was my fourth visit to this hotel in one year its hard to believe that it could get any better but it does every time.on this occasion i visited with my husband who travels quite a lot on business and he was very impressed he was like i always am treated like a friend and not just a customer.the guys on reception are excellant,michael is wonderful and so is johan nothing is too much trouble for them they are full of knowledge about the area .the hotel has a very nice restaurant and again the staff are excellant and so is the food the breakfast is lovely and Ezo is the best waiter ever he always has a smile .i have already made a reservation to stay again in july 2012 which i d.id through jacopo who like the rest of the staff is fabulous .

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Super staff.”
Reviews.Author: nevergrim
Reviews.Content: My wife and I returned to this superbly placed hotel for a wonderful four day break. (100 metres from St Marco). Right from the start, whilst making my reservation by phone, Jacopo made me feel welcome, and this wonderful service contiued throughout our stay. The resturant for breakfast is right on the lagoon and to sit outside in the sunshine and start your day with a plentiful multi choice breakfast is a pure joy. This lovely Hotel helped make our trip to this very special city all the more enjoyable. Our room was not large but perfectly equipped. A Lagoon view would have made it even better (maybe next time) I am sure there will be a next time, and definately at Savoia and Jolanda.

Reviews.Title: “Finding the Venice I like”
Reviews.Author: MariaGanja
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel primarily because of its accessability and location. I was travelling with my 76-year old mother and I cannot afford to lug our luggage around and have her walk just looking for the hotel. So I chose one that was right across the water taxi stand and it was a good decision to do that. I particularly liked how the hotel accommodated my request. After booking the hotel, i wrote them a letter telling them how this was a trip of a lifetime for my mother and it would even more special if they could give us a room with a good view. And they responded to say they would try. When we got there, they gave us a free upgrade to a room that faced the grand canal and one that was big and spacious. My mother was very impressed with the room, made her feel like a queen. It can be dizzying though watching the throng of people walking towards the square from outside your window and I can understand those who would prefer quieter locations on the other islands. The biggest PLUS staying on the main island is the opportunity it gave me to walk around at 6am while the square and alleys were still empty- i found the Venice that I liked during that walk. Priceless

Reviews.Title: “extremely friendly staff, nice and very cozy rooms”
Reviews.Author: abhilasha_india
Reviews.Content: The place is really well located and has a very warm and homely atmosphere. For honeymoon couples they instantly provide free upgradation of room. the price too is appropriate and advisable.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like Home”
Reviews.Author: lball1958
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the Savoia & Jolanda. A special mention of Hans at the front desk! He was very helpful, charming and made us feel right at home. The hotel has been maintained very lovingly. Good breakfast in the morning. Great restaurant spot to watch the world walk by on the promenade. Great location for visiting the attractions. The rooms are clean and well appointed. We had everything we needed.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: MavDubai
Reviews.Content: This was a good hotel with a fabulous location. It was very close to the water taxi stop plus was walking distance from all the main tourist attractions. However, we did feel it was a bit overpriced considering the size of the room and no view. The service was fairly good.

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Location”
Reviews.Author: Judy B
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at Savoia & Jolanda in August, 2011. We loved the location. It is right in front of the water taxi, so you go straight in with your luggage, which is perfect. We had a beautiful room overlooking the Grand Canal. There are shutters on the windows which you can close at night & it is very quiet. The staff was very friendly & helpful. The breakfast was excellent. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, so-so service”
Reviews.Author: Charles T
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel cannot be beaten. Just outside a ferry stop which will take you to the train station and the airport. However, the staff, while friendly did not seem to be too interested in assisting. Even though I had been in contact with the hotel a number of times and they knew the festival of Redentore was on, they did not let me know that ferries would not go all the way to the hotel and I would have to walk for a distance and cross bridges with heavy bags. I was not notified that my room rate included a water taxi and guided tour of Murano and it was only by accident that we found out. Also, despite booking the most expensive room on offer and booking months in advance and requesting a high floor room as there was a fireworks display on for Redentore, I got a room on the lowest floor possible. The worst part was that when I got home, I received my credit card bill and saw that they charged me for my hotel room a few days before I checked in and then again on check out. When I emailed the hotel to try to sort it out, I got no reply and had to get my Amex to put a stop to one of the charges, Will I stay here again? Yes, for the location and knowing how things are in Venice, will not have to interact with the staff much. Get a lagoon view room if you can afford it, the view is amazing.

Reviews.Title: “"Great location" Would stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: Ozzial
Reviews.Content: While staying in Venice, it was our pleasure to be accommodated at the Hotel Savoui & Jolanda. The rooms are clean and spacious, set in a kind or Baroque style with views overlooking the water promenade The hotel is located adjacent to San Zaccaria ferry Station and just a short stroll from St Marks Square. This is a Great Hotel with great service and with a more than helpful and informative staff. They serve a buffet breakfast that is hard to beat. They can organize any tours or sightseeing that you may require. They also have a sister hotel, The Hotel Villa Igea which is located in the small square that flanks the hotel. This is also recommended, if they have no bookings available. The hotel restaurant was a bit overpriced for our budget so we ate mostly at a small traditional street restaurant the Tratoria da Nino, located 2 minutes walk away, in a small street at the rear of the hotel. The food and wine served here, were both affordable and superb. To avoid the exorbitant prices charged by the water taxis, we caught the public ferry (Ferovia) cost was 7 euros, from Venice Station to San Zaccaria boat station right in front of the hotel. This was an enjoyable experience

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming , helpful , great location .”
Reviews.Author: Benmac1
Reviews.Content: We had a two night stay in one of the junior suites and I have to say it was perfect . The room was spacious and a good balcony where we could sit and watch all the activity on the stalls below in front of the hotel . The ferry droped us off only 3 mins walk from the hotel and my wife and 8 year old daughter were delighted when we walked into the reception and were greated with a smile and good welcome . The only mistake we made was we didn't eat more in the hotel . There was a good selection of dishes at good prices and the staff served with a smile . I will book here again .

Reviews.Title: “Watch your bill”
Reviews.Author: jeff g
Reviews.Content: A/C works poorly. Included breakfast is just OK and doesn't change from day to day. Be careful when you check out. They offer you the opportunity to pay in dollars or Euros. They don't explain to you that if you elect dollars, they will tack on an additional 3%!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved our balcony and large suite”
Reviews.Author: Gayle V
Reviews.Content: Great location right next to the Danielli Hotel. We had the junior suite on the top floor, only 2 in the hotel with large bathroom (jacuzzi tub) and big shower. The best was the balcony with view of grand canal to the right and lagoon to the left. Electric blinds that black out the sun in the morning. Staff very friendly, buffet breakfast excellent - served at the outdoor restaurant. Matteo at the front desk was very nice. Short walk to San Marco also very convenient to have a vaparetto stop out front although they don't always stop there. We would go back to this hotel - highly recommend it!!

Reviews.Title: “disappointed as moved to sister hotel villa igea”
Reviews.Author: nicolajgraham
Reviews.Content: After staying in venice near the Grand canal prior to our 7 nt cruise, we were very much looking forward to our final night in Venice at the Savoia and Jolanda. Unfortunately on arrival we were advised by reception that we were to be moved to the Villa Igea hotel (3*) 50m behind the Savoia. Although reception were helpful, the same cannot be said of the waiting staff outside the hotel servicing the restaurant in the evening. They need to The breakfast staff were better. We were disappointed with our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently Located”
Reviews.Author: Zaufyshan H
Reviews.Content: You can read the name of the hotel on the facade of building itself. Do not get nervous if you cannot find the location. Always point to the name of the hotel on the map, to the local venetians vendors. The view of the water is amazing from the Suite on the third floor. The single rooms are small sized, but the suite is quite large with a nice sitting room. The bathroom of the suite is huge equipped with a jacuzzi. The rates in 2007 were higher than the usual 3/4 star hotels in Italy. 7-8 mns away from Piazza San Marco, it is an ideal location. The reception can help you with the tours information.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and well located”
Reviews.Author: Jim255350
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located on the Riva degli Schiavoni, the wide esplanade that is the waterfront of the Canale di San Marco. It is located directly opposite one of the several ferry wharves of San Zaccaria only about 200 metres from Piazza San Marco. In fact when using the Alilaguna Ferry that services Marco Polo International Airport the front door of the hotel is the very first door directly opposite where you disembark from the ferry or catch the ferry to the airport. Manoeuvring luggage in Venice is not ideal due to the numerous bridges, narrow paths and cobblestones. Ideally a hotel should be located with transportation of luggage in mind, be comfortable as well as have a general location in proximity to places of interest. The Hotel Savoia & Jolanda meets these criteria. We selected it after reading previous reviews on Tripadvisor. In terms of comfort, rooms are relatively small compared to Australian hotels but were comfortable and had the key basic requirements. It had a restaurant on the ground floor that extended onto the esplanade which was ideal for eating & people watching as well as taking in movements of gondolas, ferries and ships on the water. It also offered 20% discount on meal costs to its hotel guests. This made their prices virtually the same as those in many of the narrow lanes where the heat in summer could be oppressive and the only views were of people in the lane at the time. We tried both and agreed that the hotel restaurant was the best way to experience eating while taking in the scenery.

Reviews.Title: “Well located hotel”
Reviews.Author: diane160468
Reviews.Content: Well located facing the lagoon easy to get to all attractions. Rooms good size but in need of decoration. Rooms faced the side street could be a little noisy at night and early morning. Restaurant and staff very friendly. Expensive but then it is Venice

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff, great location, but old and dirty rooms.”
Reviews.Author: WinwinDover_Delaware
Reviews.Content: The staff was lovely and tried to help us change our rooms, but they were unable to do so. The room we had was very old, in desperate need of repair, and dirty. It had a very powerful smell that we were unable to get rid of. The carpeting in the room, halls, and lobby were badly stained and very worn. The bathroom was small and there was mold in the corners of the shower (which was not at all forceful). When we booked the rooms we were promised a view of the canal, but were not given one. We were told they only had a few rooms like that and they were taken. Our room overlooked a dingy alleyway and faced a wall. The breakfast was fine, but we had better at other hotels in Italy. The best aspect was the location, which was right on the Grand Canal and within walking distance of St. Mark's square.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, very close to key tourist areas.”
Reviews.Author: Cubaloverforever
Reviews.Content: Was pleased with hotel and location. Front desk clerk was very accommodating and patient, given the busy time that we arrived. Room was adequate for a European location. Wifi is not free. Considering the price, they should reconsider. Would I go back...yes.

Reviews.Title: “Well located on the canal”
Reviews.Author: irishkiwi_8
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located a minute's walk from Piazza San Marco, near the vaporetto stop. Hotel checkin was courteous and efficient. The room we had was internal with a small window balcony and was very quiet. The furnishings were Italian style, with a large bathroom and a deep bath. For the buffet breakfast you could sit at the hotel tables out on the pavement and watch the world go by on the canal grande.

Reviews.Title: “Gets better every time!”
Reviews.Author: maureendavies55
Reviews.Content: just returned from another fantastic stay at this hotel .hotel staff welcomed us back as if we were friends.i travelled with my daughter and the service we recieved at this hotel far excedes what we have experienced at other hotels.We were given a totally newly refurbished room which was very comfortable with a very modern bath room .The location of this hotel is excellant set on a lovelly promenade with easy acess to transport and very close to st.marks square.This is our third visit in one year and we have already booked to return in november this year only difference being we are bringing my husband along ithink it is only fair we share this wonderful hotel with him.I would also recommend the food at the hotel restaurant the manager stefano and his staff are fabulous and nothing is too much trouble for them"i would particurally recommed the sea food risotto"and my daughter is already counting the days to when we return to venice and this hotel which says it all when a 22y.r old woman says its the best place ever considering she is travelling with her mother and not out clubbing and she does on other holidays .maureen and sian davies cardiff u.k.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular off-season trip”
Reviews.Author: RET46
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic time in Venice over X-mas. This hotel was perfectly located, charmingly appointed and beautifully managed. The staff couldn't have been more friendly and personable. The room was small but extremely comfortable and beautifully decorated. Venice is expensive and this hotel was reasonably priced and located. Perhaps at high season, it's a drag to be right on the main-thoroughfare but for us at Christmas it was extremely convenience and magical.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: hardydesk
Reviews.Content: Long time follower of Tripadvisor and picked this hotel on the recommendation of fellow travelers. Was not disappointed! The location couldn't be beat. So close to St. Mark's square. Staff was friendly. Room was clean and big enough for 2 people. I also went with the recommended Room #302. I emailed the hotel ahead of time and requested this view room and got it. The room has a small balcony with table and chairs that we were able to sit out on and have a beautiful view of the water and also watch the world go by right below us. There is a water bus stop so close to the hotel that it made it easy to get around the city. We had the included breakfast at the hotel restaurant and although it was typical for Europe, I found the quality and choices to be good. One of the nicer features of the hotel lobby were these beautiful stargazer lilly's in vases throughout the lobby. The smell was divine! I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Can not beat location and value of this little gem”
Reviews.Author: artful9
Reviews.Content: Lodging in Venice is tricky. There are the five star hotels that will set you back hundreds of euros and low end "quaint". This hotel is modestly priced and a very good value. We stayed in 315 which was very quite and nicely redone recently. Rooms are small but comfortable. We did not have a water view but we wanted quite. The front desk staff was very helpful and arranged for our transportation from airport to hotel and then water taxi to our cruise ship. Thomas was very helpful with dining, transportation and sites. Buffet breakfast was good and included. Location can not be beat!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and Good location.”
Reviews.Author: Rocco2006
Reviews.Content: I visited the hotel and I have been very happy with my visit, the location of the hotel is very good just minutes from Venice main attractions, with a very nice view, some of the rooms have a delightful view, the staff is very friendly, they have a restaurant where you can take breakfast (that was included) inside or "al fresco". They gave us the biggest suite of the hotel and the view was excellent. Other rooms also have balcony and nice views. Rooms are well equipped, and have a venetian style. A very good option in Venice and it is located in front of the alilaguna stop, so it makes it really convenient. Very near of St. Mark's Square.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and quaint old Venetian style”
Reviews.Author: Family_on_the_go1962
Reviews.Content: Very quaint old Venetian style hotel with wood beam ceilings and lots of red and gold colouring. The room for the three of us (two adults and one child) was spacious and the single bed was comfortable and not a roll away as we feared. The view was of the side alley and it was OK but we would have loved a view over the water. The bathroom was enormous! The breakfasts are OK nothing to write home about but not bad either and the setting overlooking the waterfront is fantastic. Front counter service is good and professional. We did have some problems obtaining a water taxi from the hotel (the stop is just outside) to the departure dock for our ferry to Corfu but the front counter staff continued to persist on our behalf. No hotel in Venice is cheap so I think this is probably value for money but is pretty pricy just like all the rest. The location just down from St Marks etc was brilliant. Lots of transport at your doorstep. A word about the food in Venice - while it is OK it is not cheap by Italian standards and the portions are not generous probably because of having to bring everything in by water. We were spoilt by staying just prior to this on the Amalfi Coast where the food was superb and a bit cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Location, Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Leemoo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights while exploring Venice and could not have found a better location in the city to use as a base. The hotel is 2 minutes walk from St Mark's Square and right next to the vaporetto piers for numbers 1 & 2 (among others). The front of the hotel looks right across the lagoon towards Cipriani and is more or less at the entrance to the Grand Canal, which provided lots of opportunity for people watching over a lovely cup of Italian coffee. Room was very clean and a good size with very efficient air con. The furnishings in the room were of a high standard and reasonably 'plush' compared to some more simple ones in Italy. Breakfast was of a very good standard with a good choice of food and hot drinks available. Probably wouldn't suggest eating at the restaurant during the day (or indeed any of the others nearby) as they all seemed very pricey (even for Venice!) for what you got, it also seems to attract lots of daytrippers from coaches/cruises, which is possibly why it is quite so pricey. Check out backstreets and small piazzas in Venice for good places to eat, we were recommended 'Bandierette' on Barbaria delle Tole. It is about 15 mins pleasant walk north of the hotel and serves great local seafood at very good prices. (Menu of the day was less than 50 Euros for two including wine.)

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: diricc
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I spent 2 nights here as part of a graduation trip. The hotel was very easy to get to from the train station via ferry. The stop is right outside the hotel so this makes it very convenient when travelling with luggage. The staff was very helpful in getting us oriented and making suggestions. We stayed in a junior suite overlooking the canal with a beautiful view. We enjoyed our complimentary Prosecco people watching from the balcony before dinner. It was conveniently located for sight-seeing and shopping. Would definitely stay here again. Complimentary breakfast was also very good with outdoor seating perfect to watch the early morning hustle and bustle.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: erchurch
Reviews.Content: What a great location! Overlooking the Grand Canal and in the middle of everything! Breakfast in the outdoor cafe was wonderful and the staff was very helpful. The room was lovely, though rather small and dark. No view whatsoever! The bathroom was the real weak point: it was a small and dated. Also, the power for the hotel went out for a few minutes one evening, and that was scary. Overall, we liked the hotel a lot--it was full of character and you can't beat the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable and good value”
Reviews.Author: JimboBerlin
Reviews.Content: On my recent trip to Venice I managed to book this hotel in combination with my British Airways flight, which provided me with a discount on www.ba.com The hotel's location is great, just off St Marco's Square and on the canal and the price was reasonable when compared what other good hotels were charging per night in this somewhat expensive city. The staff were very helpful and the room, though reltively small was sufficiently large to be comfortable. The bed and pillows were decent as well, which allowed us a good nights sleep. The only down side is that this hotel still feels that it's necessary to charge for internet, which I think is sooooooo passe.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: benohen
Reviews.Content: The location was great, really close to St. Mark's Square. The restaurant had an outdoor and an indoor dining area and the food was very good. The lobby was attractive and comfortable and the staff was friendly. For some reason we were given a family room, which was a tiny master bedroom (we had to keep our luggage in the other room) and another bedroom that we didn't need. One room that was a little bigtger than the master bedroom would have been much more comfortable. We were also on the first floor and it was very noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location !”
Reviews.Author: MallamaciTours
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my group of 14, aug 2010, balcony views, right on lagoon, next to st. Marks square. Beautiful rooms, excellent staff, great breakfast. I'll be back with a new group early July 2011, appresto Roberto !

Reviews.Title: “Best location, service and accommodations in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: julie10e
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay in Venice. The hotel is near the main water travel and that is very, very important when you arrive with luggage. Otherwise, it is a haul to hotels. We loved being near the square and on the water. We had a newly remodeled room and bath and it was great. The staff was very friendly and made us feel very welcome! We would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, but service could use some improvement”
Reviews.Author: Tom60713
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location if you want to be in the middle of the action. It faces the Grand Canal about two blocks from San Marco Plaza. The ferries, water taxis and gondolas are right outside the front door. We had a junior suite with a balcony facing the Grand Canal. It was a very comfortable size and well appointed. The restaurant at the hotel (and all the surrounding restaurants) cater exclusively to tourists. As a result they seem focused on turning the tables quickly and the service is so-so.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel. Staff unfriendly, need to go, ruined the charm.”
Reviews.Author: magical66
Reviews.Content: Have to say the hotel itself was lovely. Charming for such an old structure. Can't complain about the room or the location. It was the staff of the hotel and restaurant that ruined the magic. They were very unfriendly. Maybe because they recognized that we were American??? Not sure. Do NOT eat at the restaurant. We were practically "harassed" into going into the restaurant by one of the waiters that was obnoxiously rounding in customers to come in to eat there. That should have been a clue as to why the restaurant was not that busy at about 8:00 in the evening! Our server was a young woman-not Italian- who could or would not speak English-and seemed put out when we asked for her suggestions on the menu. Food not that great and over priced. Overall, a bad restaurant experience for our first night in Venice.. Take this review as you like. You have been warned!

Reviews.Title: “Third time and still amazing”
Reviews.Author: Eddie1992
Reviews.Content: I went to venice for the easter weekend with my family and stayed in the hotel for the third time, we always get the interconnecting room in the third floor which comes with two bathrooms fitted with whirlpool baths which have always been a nice feature. The lagoon view over venice is absolutely stunning, with the great sights of san gorgio and guideca easily visable, with the Lido even in sight on a clear day. The hotel as a location is perfect, a quick five minute walk from San marco and a short journey from Rialto, the hotel also has a very nice resturant with a 20% discount for hotel guests (id recomend trying the cuttlefish spaghetti) The maid service was exceptional, with two room cleans a day. Be prepared for extensive restoration works throughout the city, dont be dissapointed if some attractions are coverd up and the city is old and sinking Overall id give the hotel 8.5/10 Oh, id also recomend waking up extra early to see San marco before the day trippers arrive, its a quite moving experience. :)

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel. We'll be back.”
Reviews.Author: ThePelikans
Reviews.Content: When we landed in Venice we purchased a 72 hour vaparetto pass from the counters at the airport. (just outside the luggage area) Then we took a bus and got off at the wrong stop, took another and got into the big bus drop off zone near the train station. We took the #1 line to the Zaccaria stop. The hotel is RIGHT in front. Very nice when you're traveling with luggage. The front desk staff were awesome and were a great help. They have wi-fi that you have to pay for, but it's pretty cheap and worth it to connect to home. (we had iphones and they worked all over italy on wi-fi) We were lucky enough to get an upgrade to a suite overlooking the grand canal. Wow! it was fantastic! The room was very clean, the furniture was very interesting and comfortable. The bathroom was gigantic and had a big jacuzzi tub and a tiny shower stall. There were a couple channels in English on the tv, but that is hardly the hotels fault. (Come on. You're in Venice! Who needs TV?) The location itself was great and easy to get to and from. We did not eat at the hotel restaurant. The free breakfast everyday was excellent. I heard there a was a free shuttle to Murano, but we just took one of the vaparatto lines. No problem! Next time we're in Venice we will come straight here without question for our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have made a better choice”
Reviews.Author: Needsumnow
Reviews.Content: I had originally tried to book at another hotel closer to train station but was offered this hotel instead. I'm so glad I accepted-it turned out to be the most memorable. We had booked a triple and were told upon check-in that we would be given two rooms for one night then moved to a triple for our remaining stay. I got one room to myself. Yes, it did look upon an alley with another room across the way but I closed the shutters leaving the balcony door open to allow for air circulation and slept soundly. The bathroom was spotless with a strong shower spray. The next day we left for touring and when we returned, our suitcases had been moved to our triple room. I immediately opened the balcony doors facing the waterfront, people-watched and napped until dinner. There were a few television stations that had English-speaking channels - one even had the television show in English with commercials in Italian. We ate our delicious breakfast at the hotel (hot coffee with warm cream-yum) but we did not take other meals there even with cajoling from the maitre d'hotel. There are just too many options down the various alleys. We had no issue with noise; we didn't even know we had someone in the next room until they stepped onto their balcony. The triple-room bathroom was spacious with another strong shower. The only issue we had (and it was a minor one) was there was no storage so we ended up living out of our suitcases. The staff greeted us each time we passed and treated us quite well at check-in - and why not, they get to work and live in a place most folks only dream about. Overall, a memorable stay. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and highly recommended hotel”
Reviews.Author: noel56
Reviews.Content: just returned from our holiday in Venice and a four night stay at the Savoia & Jolanda in Riva dei Schiavoni. This is a four star hotel and the location is situated in one of the best areas in Venice. Optimum views and we had a junior suite Room 304 with breathtaking view of the lagoon. Within walking distance from Piazza San Marco and Vaporetto fermata San Zaccaria is just in front of the hotel which is very convenient if you are arriving by water taxi or ferry. Although we never ate at the Hotel's restaurant, this was always packed and breakfast was excellant. Great hotel and would return

Reviews.Title: “Very simply, GREAT”
Reviews.Author: TimSS
Reviews.Content: We travelled from Rome, to Florence, and then onto Venice. This was by far the best hotel. For the cost, I thought they would have to charge us extra for being so nice. The room was quaint and clean. The service and staff were outstanding. And the locationâ€¦â€¦.right in front of the stop for the airport boat/shuttle. Also right in front of any stop you needed, from going up the Grand Canal, Lido, or Murano. Take the number one from the train station; get off at Zaccaria (St Marks), and your there.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel, excellent service, superb location”
Reviews.Author: 1984ladybird
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Savoia & Jolanda Hotel for 3 nights from 23rd-26th March in room 219 and had a fantastic time. Originally we had booked to stay at the sister hotel Villa Igea however when we went to check in (check in for the Igea is in the Savoia Jolanda) we were upgraded to the Savoia which was a very pleasant surprise. You cannot beat the location of this hotel, it's directly opposite the Zacharria water bus stop and just a 30 second walk from St Marks Square and Basillica-you couldnt be more central if you tried! The service was excellent, the staff were extremely friendly and helpful-nothing was too much trouble, the porter was really cheerful and showed us to our room with our bags Breakfast was buffet style with a wide range of choices including hot eggs and bacon along with the usual continental stuff, it's served in the restaurant downstairs which also has a terrace looking out onto the Riga degli Shiavoni and beyond into the lagoon-really beautiful The room we had was nicely decorated and comfortable-absolutely no complaints, we didnt have a view but then we didnt come to Venice to spend time in our hotel all the time so it didnt really matter, the bathroom I have to say was a little tired-could have done with a bit of a sprucing up given that it's 4 star For us we really enjoyed staying at this hotel however if you're looking for a 4* then I would bear in mind this is probably a bit more of a 3.5*. The only reasons being little things like the fact there is no room service, and no free wifi access, there was also no information book in the room providing details of local attractions and maybe a map or something, plus as I say the bathroom was in need of a little attention-only small details but it's these things that would probably make the hotel more of a 4 star. As we were upgraded from a 3* anyway it wasnt a problem for us. I have read some previous reviews regarding bad smells in the hotel, there were a couple of occasions we got a slight whiff of drains however bear in mind you are in VENICE! A city built entirely on water where everybody's bath and sink water drains out into the canals-everywhere you go in Venice you sometimes get a bit of a damp/drain smell and the hotter the weather the worse it becomes, it goes with the territory and I wouldnt say this is a reflection on the hotel at all. Guests at the hotel get a discount on food (not drinks) at the hotel the restaurant 'Principessa' we had lunch here one day and although it was perfectly acceptable you are paying a huge premium for the location, if you want a cheaper coffee then go to Cafe Aurrora on the piazza where you get a discount if you show your hotel card The Savoia and Jolanda is on the main waterfront in Venice right in the middle of the hustle and bustle of the city, the central location is a huge strong point so if you're wanting somewhere very quiet and peaceful to come to at the end of the day then this is not the place for you We loved it though and would certainly come back again, we will be recommending it to our friends :)

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel on our Italian vacation”
Reviews.Author: pjfarr1
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights at the end of our tour of Italy. I had contacted the hotel in advance about directions, and they were friendly and prompt in getting back to me. The hotel has a great location directly off the San Zaccharia stop. Great for people watching. We had a junior suite on the first floor which provided a great view, without being too noisy. There were automatic metal blinds which blocked it all out. Room was beautiful, tons of Murano glass. Ample bathroom with tub. Service was absolutely first class. Always ready with directiona and recommendations. They even escorted us to our water taxi with umbrellas, even though we insisted that was not necessary. On our last morning, since we were leaving early, they gave us bagged breakfast with water, juices, fruits, croissants, etc... a nice touch. Location couldnt be beat! We could walk anywhere, were right next to St Marks. Venice is a tough city to navigate around. Prepare to get lost regardless of your map. Have fun with it! Breakfast was provided in the restaurant. There were plenty of seats, and the food chioces were ample. every night, we sat outside the hotel on the patio with Prosecco and took in Venice. It is a cool place. We would absolutely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Style, romance and luxury”
Reviews.Author: Jane1706
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night in the first week of February. We had stayed before and we liked the hotel. We arrived to a very friendly welcome to be told that the standard room we had booked was not available and we had been upgraded to a deluxe room. We had a fantastic view with a double balcony a huge comfortable bed and a large very well appointed bathroom. I can only say that it was perfect. We were looking forward to using the hotel restaurant but unfortunately it was closed for renovation. We ordered breakfast in our room (at no extra cost) and it was amazing; the scrambled egg was the best my husband has ever had and everything was served beautifully. What can be more romantic than having a wonderful breakfast sitting on the balcony with a spectacular view on a bright sunny morning with the person you love. Thank you Savoia and Jolanda for making this possible. All your staff are brilliant and we will be back. The problem will be affording the deluxe room as I doubt we will be so lucky again to be upgraded.

Reviews.Title: “A Room with a View”
Reviews.Author: SlowFoodGuru
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Savoia e Jolanda after a weeklong ski trip in Cortina d'Ampezzo. We were exhausted when we arrived, cold, and I was a little worried that our room would not be up to snuff. My fears were immediately put to rest by the friendly staff as soon as we arrived. Our bags were taken to our rooms and I was so relieved to find not only a clean, attractive (much better in person) and well-appointed room, but a huge bathroom complete with spa, luxurious towels and robes, and really nice toiletries. We were located on the first floor facing the Grand Canal, so despite the incredible view of San Giorgio Maggiore I was concerned about noise. This, however, was not a problem as the building and windows were sound and kept out all the noise. The breakfast was terrific and included a full European style spread as well as American-style fare. The staff was very helpful, charming and friendly. They accommodated us in everything, from restaurant reservations to transportation. This hotel is central to everything and right across from a Vaporetto stop for easy access to the entire city. Wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: cdp915
Reviews.Content: My husband and I planned a two week vacation to Italy. Savoia and Jolanda was the first hotel we stayed in to start off our trip. The location of this hotel is EXCELLENT. It is directly in front of the San Marcos water bus stop. It is also less than a 10 minute walk to St. Markâ€™s square. The room itself is a fairly decent size, quaint. The bathroom is smaller than we are use to compared to hotels in the US. Most importantly, it is kept very clean. The continental breakfast that is included in the price of the hotel is very good! It is served in a nice dining room from 7:00 am-10:00 am. We would fill up on breakfast and just snack throughout the day. The staff is very attentive, polite and prompt. The hotel also offers a free tour to Murano Island. We thought that there would be strings attached, but there was absolutely no pressure to purchase anything when we got to Murano Island. Transportation on a private motor boat was provided. On the way back, they gave us a ticket for the water bus and were free to stay on the island for as long as we wanted. This is a great hotel. The only thing is that they charge a fee to use their wi-fi. Other than that, no regrets staying here. Great way to start off our trip!

Reviews.Title: “Room with one of the best views in Venice”
Reviews.Author: anysDublin
Reviews.Content: Just back from five days in Venice. Stayed in a room with lagoon view on third floor. Absolutely fab! Lovely large room with double balcony. Breakfast excellent. Staff very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location and nice staff”
Reviews.Author: mikerendall
Reviews.Content: the hotel savoia jolanda is perfect : located at few seconds form san mark's, rooms well appointed and great service. We booked a standard room and the furniture was stilish, the buffet breakfast offers a large selection of everything.....i will definately come back

Reviews.Title: “Do not chose this hotel”
Reviews.Author: pkdogowner
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Savoia & Jolanda Hotel in Dec 2010. It was the worst hotel during our entire trip to Italy (we where there for over two weeks). The size of room was slightly bigger than our walk-in closet at home. We got a horrible view, it was the wall of the next building. The walls of the room where paper thin. We could hear everything in the rooms next to us. People's conversation where heard clearly. Every morning, the whole building smelled like rotten eggs. After, we stayed there, we figured why some people commented very positively about the hotel, because the location is great and some room's (very few) have a view of the lagoon. That could be the only reason they get a positive comment. Other than that, it does not deserve a 4 star rating. We loved Venice and we will visit again, but we never go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Room without a view : beware of promotions!”
Reviews.Author: jack_gats
Reviews.Content: At 113 euros a night, this 4-star hotel in Venice was apparently a bargain, even in the middle of winter and with Venice plagued by flooding. Details unworthy of a 4-star hotel are the lack of any TV program in any language but Italian and the noisy heating (air-con device). But the shock to us was the room view, or rather the absence of it. We knew we had booked a "Room with City view", not one of the superior rooms looking out onto the lagoon. We also knew that "City view" is not strictly synonymous with "View of the City". But we were unprepared to land in a room looking out onto a pit, a dark room with hardly any outdoor light shining in. Lights had to be switched on at any time during the day for anything except sleep. Is such a scam legal? It probably is. Hey, what did we expect? This is Venice, the biggest, longest-standing tourist trap in the world.

Reviews.Title: “absoloutly fabulous”
Reviews.Author: maureendavies55
Reviews.Content: stayed in this hotel in july this year with my 22 yr.old daughter it was her first visit to venice and iwas worried because we were two women travelling alone. i needent have worried the hotel is in such a good location and all amenities to get round venice are on the doorstep. the hotel staff are excellant and so are the restaurant staff .we enjoyed our stay so much that we returned in november and stayed another 5 nights it was really lovely and the staff treated us like friends .we are now planning our next trip back hopefully june 2011.my only negative is avoid the private trip to murano .

Reviews.Title: “A Very nice place!”
Reviews.Author: Jan-Harvey2010
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel with a very friendly and helpful staff, working under the watchful eye of manager Roberto. Our room was clean and comfortable, the dining room had a fine breakfast each morning, and the desk staff had plenty of good advice about what to see and how to get around in the city. It's an old European hotel and, as such, has charm and intimacy. The location -- right on the Grand Canal -- is great, and we would go back without any hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous place to stay”
Reviews.Author: SueBye
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location, very comfortable - a feeling of being discretely looked after. Breakfast very tasty. Staff coped well with the flooding - efficiently got on with making sure it was managed while we ate. A pleasure from start to finish. Adored Venice - bobbing in a vaporetto is better that being in our earthquke prone city post the 7.1 in early Sept.

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel !!”
Reviews.Author: Valycris
Reviews.Content: This hotel was everything we were expecting and more ! ... We couldn't have asked for a better location ! ... Right in front of the Canal ! ... And right behind St. Mark Square ... No walking through the city with all your bags when you arrive and when you leave, the port is right there ... The view from our room was spectacular !! The Gran Canal with the gondolas, and the Dodge Palace right next to us ... We got the junior suite and it wad fantastic, so spacious ! Clean and nicely decorated ... The hotel staff were all great, and the breakfast was really nice too, American style with eggs, bacon, lots of pastries, cheeses, hams, juices and great coffee ... Overall, we LOVED this hotel and we would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel, great location, reception staff let it down though!”
Reviews.Author: Linda2288
Reviews.Content: The hotel was beautiful and the water taxi from the airport stopped right outside so no bridges to carry suitcases over. We had a junior suite with partial view of the lagoon which had an enormous round bed and a jacuzzi. We booked the lovers package as it was our silver wedding anniversary which we thought would help us budget and this included a water taxi to Murano glass factory (which was a high sell pressure day from the staff there) but the private taxi to ourselves was nice, a gondola ride which turned out to be very romantic after we had managed to extract our voucher from the hotel receptionist who kept referring to us as "the package" like we were low life and then we had to argue with the gondolier who knew nothing about a hotel voucher and then shouted to the other gondoliers in Italian, making us feel very uncomfortable like we were ripping him off. There was sparkling wine and chocolate hearts in the room on our arrival which was nice and they included a turndown service with lovely fluffy robes and slippers. Also included was a candlelit dinner in the hotel which was delicious. I would highly recommend the hotel but just book room only as it was too painful trying to claim anything that we were entitled to. We should have had a newspaper everyday and fresh flowers which never appeared but it was too exhausting to enquire! All in all though, perfect weekend, perfect weather and would go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel - wonderful location - not too expensive”
Reviews.Author: tdew99
Reviews.Content: A group of six friends visited Venice in September 2010. On arrival we found that the three rooms reserved for us were all ones with only a double bed. Only one single bedded room could be arranged, but we were offered a suite for four people. It was wonderful! Though we only had one giant bathroom to share, we also had a balcony overlooking the Grand Canal. It was a lovely way to enjoy the view above the crowd. We enjoyed the restaurant a few times. Breakfast was great. We would stay there again if visiting Venice. My only complaint would be the charge for internet service. Somewhere I'd gotten the idea that it was free...

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing - Despite The Location!”
Reviews.Author: OscarLeicestershire
Reviews.Content: Found the hotel very easily as it is right opposite the Blu/Red Line from the Airport. Were greeted by a slightly off-hand receptionist who accompanied us to our room. To be honest we were very disappointed with the accommodation. It was on the side of the hotel with one very tiny window which meant we had to have the lights on all the time. The view was of someone else's hotel room across the alleyway. There were no tea-making facilities and limited channels on the TV, however it was and remained very clean for our five day stay. We felt the hotel might benefit from having a bar as the room was so small at the end of the day we wanted somewhere to relax and enjoy a cool beer! We had taken the option of staying half-board and would advise anyone else not to bother. The menu in the adjoining restaurant is extremely limited and very bland and boring. Residents are instructed to inform the restaurant staff when they enter the dining area that they are residents and to give their room number. The menu presented is the 'Tourist' menu at a cost of 15 Euros. When your choice eventually arrives it is obvious it has been pre-cooked and then heated up on a hot plate/microwave (my carbonara had a skin on it on each of the three days we ate there). Even though we were booked in for five nights we gave up on the restaurant after three and ate elsewhere. TOP TIP - forget the half board its not worth it. Having stayed in many hotels we felt this one was over-rated and only the location saves it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Great Service, Gorgeous Room!”
Reviews.Author: GraziellaC4
Reviews.Content: Loved it, loved it, loved it! The location is fantastic, you can get the regular public ferry to the main island and literally when you get off the boat the hotel is right in front of you! Service was FANTASTIC (which can be hard to find in Italy!) and their restaurant is great also. We were upgraded to a room with a view which just made the whole stay in Venice that much more magical. I cant recommend this hotel enough, we travelled all over europe and this was one of the highlights. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: asd24
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel centrally located in the heart of Venice. Excellent staff who really take good care of their guests. Resteraunt was also very good but pricey ( but then again so is Venice).

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AEROTRAVELLING
Reviews.Content: Location, efficient but friendly service and room good 4 stars. Cannot really come up with any points to complain about, as we were overall satisfied with the hotel. Our superior room was beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel service”
Reviews.Author: Melgyn
Reviews.Content: Im impressed with all the service, since reception till cuisine. The employees are always happy and welcome. I loved the well served breakfast and the hotels location, near to Piazza San Marco.

Reviews.Title: “perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: bamby123654
Reviews.Content: ideal location, well appointed rooms, very clean. Try the principessa restaurant, very good and with a wide selection of wines

Reviews.Title: “VENICE VENTURE”
Reviews.Author: PANAYURSR
Reviews.Content: Venice is a beautiful tourist spot. Lot to see and enjoy. Ornaments and gift items made of glass is worth buying. Gondola ride should not be missed. Walking Tour through Venice should not be missed as guides explain everything in detail about the city.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING HOTEL... BEST LOCATION...”
Reviews.Author: ceaders
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my family for one night only as i heard that venice is small and one night is more than enough... yet after my visit to venice and J&S hotel, i wish my stay in venice was at least for 4 nights!! Both the hotel and venice were wonderful... J&S hotel made us feel at home, although they were fully booked yet they gave my family all the attention and all their support.. The staff were professional and friendly from the first second we arrived, i have booked a junior suite and it was worth every single euro, i also booked a reqular room for my children which was very good also for them... The suit made us feel like the royal family with the BEST view in venice... The lift was too small yet we were fine with that and didn't mind it at alll. I have to mention Mr. Roberto who was of great help to my kids when we got lost in the islands around venice and didn't too us long to come back to hotel.. he gave them all the support and assistance and didn't show any sign of being upset on the coontrary he was very supportive and understanding together with his staff, we really appreciated that.. The location of the hotel can't be better, after walking all around venice for 2 days and checked other hotels, i believe that J&S had one of the best locations in venice, i really wondered why this hotel wasn't a 5 stars.. the water bus stops just infront of the hotel, as well as the water taxi's, the hotel also arranged for us a free trip to Murano island to check the glass factory, and i recommned that you go only in you are willing to buy beautiful hand made muranno glass which is not cheap... the breakfast included scrambelled eggs, cold cuts, danish pastries oats and a lot more.. i would surely recommned this hotel and promised mr. roberto to come back again..

Reviews.Title: “Best value in central Venice. Great staff, fabulous location - 3rd floor is best!”
Reviews.Author: UrbanAreaNettie14
Reviews.Content: The Savoia & Jolanda is lovely and air conditioned, located just off San Marco and the Doge's Palace, on the water with a fabulous view. Ask for a 3rd-floor room with a balcony. Everything in Venice is within walking distance but the knowledgeable staff helped us get everywhere quickly. Venice is impossible to navigate without expert assistance and Roberto was fabulously accommodating. Savoia & Jolanda's Princepessa Restaurant is WONDERFUL and the outdoor dining was entertaining and delicious. GREAT VALUE!

Reviews.Title: “when in venice, stay here, stay here, stay here!!”
Reviews.Author: andrews_sameer
Reviews.Content: where do i start? we were looking for a hotel with comfort, style and great location since my mum cant walk long distances...but not outlandishly priced...and god made sure that there was this hotel! location- cant be beat. simple. 2 minutes walk from st mark's square, right on the main tourist waterfront promenade riva degli schiavoni. the only alternative in venice to staying on this royal road is to stay on the grand canal, but we could not find a hotel which was half as good with prices to match, ultimately, we all agreed this is a superior location that staying on the canal. water taxi and water bus stand right opposite the hotel... but due to double glazed windows- NO NOISE! Rooms- wow!! what do i say? royal, grand, regal...just the definition of luxury!! unbeatable. plush royal blue and gold fittings everywhere. period furniture. breathtaking panoramic view over venice lagoon!! well, we did have the best room in the hotel, but i'm sure others are very nice too. boutique lobby. bathroom- the best we had in italy and way better than many 5 star hotels... state-of-art multi water jet shower system as well as hydro bathtub! service- brilliant! jacopo, michel, giovanni and all the others whose names i dont remember, thank you! food- delicious american breakfast. lunch and dinner at the principessa restaurant are good, but I need to be honest, we have had better in venice. the wildner restaurant next door for example. this was our best stay in italy, as good as many 5 star hotels all over the world!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great service”
Reviews.Author: abd321
Reviews.Content: We had a room with a balcony overlooking the grand canal; the view was spectacular and being able to sit outside on our balcony was was wonderful. The service at this hotel was excellent - room cleaned up twice a day. The breakfast was ok and we appreciated being able to eat outside in the restaurant overlooking the canal. Staff was very helpful and accommodating. The location, a few minutes from St Mark's Square, is excellent. The hotel could use replacement of the carpets in the common areas but that is my only complaint; we were very happy with Savoia & Jolanda Hotel. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for a hotel in Venice - San Marco”
Reviews.Author: renatl
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel. The staff were terrific. I really enjoyed their breakfast. The eggs were as great as the previous reviews I read before my trip. My room was nice and keep clean daily including a turn down each night. The location couldn't have been better. You take the Blue Line from the airport to the San Zaccaria stop and the hotel is right there. A great wine bar is right around the corner from the San Zaccaria Church. I would give this hotel a five star!!!

Reviews.Title: “Superb location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Roger.pauline
Reviews.Content: The location canâ€™t be bettered - just 400 yards from St Markâ€™s Square and directly opposite the vaporetto stops (even the airport water bus stops here). The hotel fronts on to the promenade and overlooks the lagoon. The staff are helpful & friendly and breakfast is recommended. We booked a superior city view for four nights through their website & then e-mailed for our specific requirements (twin + bathtub â€“ which we were given). This was the week of the ash in April so, over the weekend we e-mailed to see if we could postpone for one week; no reply to three e-mails so itâ€™s obvious that the back office isnâ€™t staffed at weekends. However, a phone call on the Sunday reached the very helpful concierge who said â€œno problemâ€�. When we arrived we found that weâ€™d been upgraded to a lagoon-view room although the staff didnâ€™t even mention the upgrade (most hotels â€“ on the rare occasion it happens â€“ would make a song & dance about it). The room was delightful and large by Venice standards & we are SO glad we had the lagoon view; we spent hours just sitting by the windows & watching life go by. (We were on the first floor â€“ i.e. the one above ground floor! â€“ the photo shows the view from our room.) We suspect that the â€˜city view roomsâ€™ look out onto the narrow alleys which are the pathways & will be dark so, if you can afford the extra (&, being Venice, rooms are expensive), opt for lagoon view. High season starts around 26th April; air conditioning is not switched on until 1st May (we gather this is standard for Venice). Staff were very helpful & pleasant. Breakfast was a good continental one + eggs. Dinner was disappointing & expensive â€“ although, as our guidebook says, eating in Venice is very expensive & itâ€™s difficult to eat well. There are a couple of cafÃ© bars a few streets back where we had a substantial sandwich & a beer each for lunch for c.22Euros (expensive by our standards but not bad for Venice) sitting outside watching the world go by. Donâ€™t be intimidated into buying bottled water; the tap water is excellent â€“ just take a bottle & fill it each day. There are no tea/coffee making facilities in the room. Buy the Venice Connected card (15% discount for web purchases at least 7 days ahead but note that there are no refunds). We booked water bus airport transfers (go online to get detailed directions for the 500 yard walk from airport to water bus stop), museum passes (discount for over- 60s) + a three day waterbus pass which was excellent value; validate your pass at the Welcome Venice counter at the airport but make sure you specify which days you need the waterbus pass to be valid for). We had a couple of waterbus rides up the grand canal & back (recommended â€“ try to get one of the few seats outside if the weather is good) & visited the outlying islands â€“ a full dayâ€™s trip. For one of the best views of Venice, take the water bus across to the small island directly opposite the hotel & go up the bell tower of Basilica San Giorgio Maggiore (cost 3Euros) â€“ better than the view from the bell tower in St Markâ€™s Square (cost 8 Euros).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: RemyS
Reviews.Content: I booked it 2 days before going to a week-end in Venice, when most hotels were full. Actually this one was full too but i gave a ring just in case, explained my father went there for honeymoon and that I wanted to propose to my girlfriend, and they had some still had some rooms. I choose to pay some extra euros to get a lagoon view, and they upgrade me to a junior suite. It was really a good room, with a hot tub in the bathroom, a big bed, all was very nice. The only thing to know is it that i was on the 1st floor, and you get some noise quite early (like from around 8 in the morning) coming from the waterfront... but we didn't come to Venice to sleep until 3pm so it was not that annoying. I found the breakfast really decent, but not amazing. The staff at the reception was cool and helpful. Internet wasn't free, but not so expensive (5e for 2 hours, 10e for 5). So it was a really pleasant stay, and I would recommand this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Small room,stuffy staff felt like second rate guests”
Reviews.Author: daffyhedgehog
Reviews.Content: Booked half board through Citalia. Very small room on first floor with window overlooking narrow alleyway. Rather dark and gloomy. Room was very clean but we were subjected to lots of noise at night. As we were with Citalia we felt like second rate guests. As soon as the staff recognised we were with Citalia we were offered a separate menu which was very limited. Water or drinks were not included and after a couple of meals we were totally fed up with the choices. As it was the week the volcano erupted we found ourselves stuck as we had booked our flights independently. Excellent location though as it was handy for the main sights and also close to transport links.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: menmrsj
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights April 2010 with my husband. Booked a Jr. Suite overlooking the Grand Canal, and I cannot highly enough recommend booking this sort of room. Room was large - very large by European standards - with a lovely sitting room, bedroom separated from sitting by sliding doors, a good sized bathroom with whirlpool tub and steam shower (nice touch, however it's very small; not a problem for us, but an even rather moderately sized individual will have great difficulty even getting in let alone maneuvering to wash) two lovely balconies with doors that open to allow the breeze to enter...all overlooking the lagoon with fabulous views to the left, right ,and center! Room was very clean and agree with other reviewers that housekeeping kept it so during our stay. Did have one slight infrastructure issue (shower leaked horribly), but once we notified the staff, the problem was resolved during our absence with NO fuss whatsoever. Note to the wise - if your room is looking out towards the lagoon, you'll want to make sure you close the electric shutters (controls on bedside tables - very nice arrangement) at bedtime if you value your sleep; it's bright and noisy from about 8.00a on! Staff were outstanding - very professional, knowledgeable, and efficient in addition to being very friendly. The one restaurant recommendation we requested was excellent and their organization of our water taxis were perfect. We were addressed by every staff member by name from memory at each interaction, a courtesy I quite like and which has become rather rare. Buffet breakfast was fully adequate continental style, and the inclusion in our rate was another value add feature. Did not dine there (have this crazy love for the really overpriced but divine Harry's so as always dined there one night, another at a place we love over by the Rialto Bridge). Did have coffee out on the patio during the afternoons and it was very pleasant people watching. Also had restaurant send up some espresso to our room late one eveningt; despite the fact that the restaurant was in the process of closing, the tray arrived on the arm of a very courteous individual very promptly. Location is as central as possible, with most of the water buses leaving from the 2 stops directly in front of the hotel; additionally, there are water taxis and gondolas in the same location. You are steps from St. Mark's Square & the Dodge's palace, with short walks or water journeys to all other attractions. Only downside is, well, you ARE in tourist central, and it can get noisy and crowded during the middle of the day, particularly when the cruise ships arrive! Nevermind, just spend your day out and away from the square and by 5.00p the day trippers are gone and it becomes pleasant again...if you want a bit of a change of pace, take a water bus/taxi to the Lido, rent a bicycle and spend a lovely day away from the tourist crowds along the beach.
