Alternatively, go out to the cimetrio; away from the crowds so a lovely place to while away a quiet and beautiful afternoon... Overall, we were very pleased, and would be happy to recommend (or stay again)....

Reviews.Title: “An excellent choice in a prime location”
Reviews.Author: MrRusty
Reviews.Content: We selected the Savoia & Jolanda for a short 4-day break. An excellent choice. Although we only had a "standard" room which faced a little side area rather than the lagoon itself we felt it was good value - the lagoon facing rooms obviously attract a premium price, so your choice if you think it is worth the extra. The standard of the room was comfortable and excellent. Room service attended twice a day to replace towels etc as necessary. It fully deserves its 4 stars. The included breakfast was a good selection of the usual continental choices plus eggs. Orange juice was freshly squeezed, and coffee was on the good side of average. The staff were friendly and attentive and cannot be faulted. We didn't actually eat in the Restaurant in the evening because we were so early in the season and it was just a little too quiet - we preferred somewhere a bit livelier. We would definitely choose this hotel again. Apart from its facilities, it also has an excellent and easy to reach location right next to one of the main Vaporetto terminals. (San Zaccharia) We booked this hotel through "Cities Direct" (citiesdirect.co.uk) who package hotels with discount flights (in our case Ryanair). When our homeward bound Ryanair flight out of Venice Treviso was cancelled due to fog, Cities Direct (at around midnight) booked us on to a BA flight the next day out of Venice Marco Polo, and also re-booked us back in to the S&J at their cost for an additional night, so while every body else had much hassle, we got sorted. Thank you Cities Direct and the S&J Hotel! Cities Direct also picked up the tab for all the extra taxi and Vaporetto fares.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent great position first class”
Reviews.Author: nirvana90
Reviews.Content: Great hotel which we booked via alpha rooms at a great price. I would use alpha rooms again although they have had very bad reviews! We had a Very good experience.We had 2 rooms ,one for our daughter- both overlooking the grand canal. The service was excellent the staff courteous and helpful. The rooms were great and towels changed twice a day, the breakfast was a very good buffet and its a great location for wandering all over venice and the islands.The water bus stops right outside gthe hotel Fabulous

Reviews.Title: “Top position - Fantastic value for money”
Reviews.Author: zubi77
Reviews.Content: Few steps from San Marco square, facing Riva degli schiavoni; fantastic view of San Giorgio and Giudecca; perfect service, nice room and good restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “I might be slightly biased, as we got a...”
Reviews.Author: LL_Lolly
Reviews.Content: I might be slightly biased, as we got a free upgrade to the honeymoon suite (cha-ching!), but we found the hotel perfect for our stay in magical Venice. So close to San Marco, markets right at the front door, and easy to get to wherever you want to go. The honeymoon suite is gorgeous-the only round bed in Venice, Spa bath, careful and exquisite detail throughout, and character with raked low attic ceilings. Oh, and a little balcony to see out to the canal. Daily room service, super helpful desk staff, and a great restaurant. A very special place.

Reviews.Title: “very very nice”
Reviews.Author: eretin
Reviews.Content: I spent with my family the weekend at this hotel and everthing were above my expectations. It started with our early arrival when I could check in immediately without any questions. We had a juonior suite overlooking the water and one triple on the rear corridor for our children. Both rooms very nice. The bed was extremely comfortable, and the morning shower was a dream. Very good breakfast, very very good scrambled eggs. Perfect!!

Reviews.Title: “best bed!”
Reviews.Author: svalenskaya
Reviews.Content: Definately the best bed i've slept during our vacation, rooms immaculates, wide choice at the restaurant for breakfast(homemade cakes!!!!). More then central position facing the san marco basin....5 stars!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Traveler0987654321
Reviews.Content: Located almost directly in front of San Zaccaria vaporetto stop. Didn't expect it to be this close, in fact we almost walked right past it when we got off the Alilaguna boat from the airport. I uploaded a picture of the waterfront that shows the hotel right next to the Doge's Palace and San Zaccaria stop. Good breakfast, enjoyed it. Helpful staff, no complaints there. Large bathroom with a full size bath tub. The room was clean, decent size. Pictures attached. Perfect location for sightseeing, probably not for dining. As you may see from numerous reviews, there are a lot of tourist traps with terrible food in close proximity to San Marco. Can't confirm or deny this, because we always walked further out to visit specific restaurants I researched before coming to Venice. Overall, very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad Not as great as expected but good”
Reviews.Author: ab0utand0ut
Reviews.Content: Okay after all the rave reviews of other guests I was expecting amazing. Guaranteed we had the crapiest weather over the NYE period, but we had paid for a package deal and half of what we paid for we never saw, they took some money off the final bill but even still what was outlined in our package was not included. The staff were aloof; one gentleman behind the counter was very approachable however the rest were rather aloof. The room was probably the smallest we had stayed in ad had a slanting roof which proved extremely difficult to move around as you were continually hunched over. The staff were not overly interested in what you did and in informing you of anything to do or see, which was quite disappointing after the fantastic experiences we had had in Rome and Florence. Maybe this is the service you receive when you go to Flashy hotels and if this is the case then I am happily never going to a fancy hotel again - midrange hotels for me (better value for money)

Reviews.Title: “lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: jimcoltran
Reviews.Content: very nice and spacious rooms, stunning location and staff, in one word perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations!”
Reviews.Author: hellobayo
Reviews.Content: We got a special deal (pay for 2 nights get 3) on a bed & breakfast basis. Total was under Â£500 for the pair of us. We arrived at the hotel at around 9pm, the waterfront was empty! The water bus stop was literally right in front of our hotel (10 secs walk to the reception). The staff on the desk was more than helpful and anticipated our late arrival, gave us plenty of information on tours available, time of breakfast (7-10am) and had a porter to carry our luggage to our room. On the way up to our room on the second floor, we got into a tiny lift! It was a tight squeeze with us and the porter in it. I thought to myself - if this was a glimpse of things to come, our room must be midget size too. When he opened the door to our room and proceeded to show us around, we were so surprised! We really didn't understand why people were complaining! I'll list the things which I'd like to address: - We booked a standard room and it was big for European standards. Exposed rustic wooden beams, convenience of a nice LCD TV with 4 English channnels, lovely soft carpet, huge bathroom, lots of space for luggage & all the shopping you're going to buy. - Some people complained that the hotel can do with an update. Yes, there was some discolouration here and there. The bathroom could benefit from an extractor fan to reduce condensation. But overall, the hotel and our room exudes 'old world' luxury which I loved. - The bathroom could use a bath, instead of just having a shower cubicle... but this is Venice. - We were provided with 2 fluffy white bathrobes & 6 towels and an evening turn down service daily. -Their toiletry set extended to include cotton buds, make up pads and nail file. The latter was a godsend as chipped a nail carrying our bags! - The breakfast! OMG! I was speechless at the quality! To be fair, the choice was your standard European hotel selection. But the quality was amazing. I've never tasted better scrambled eggs! The waiters were all handsomely dressed in smart white suits and served us with such politeness (a novelty in Italy we've discovered), we really enjoyed breakfast. And the view of the waterfront and people strolling by was worth staying for another pot of tea. - The hotel runs free Murano glass workshop tours daily. We were lucky enough to be the only people on the tour that morning and had a water taxi all to ourselves. The captain of the taxi was chatty and informative, we had a right laugh over the failingsof Italian & UK politics. Absolutely no pressure to buy glassware after the show was over and we were given two water bus passes to take us wherever we wanted to go afterwards - so not restricted to going back to the hotel. One thing I'd like to mention is that when we checked in, we were told that we'd get 20% of our food bill at the restaurant. One evening we ate 'in' choosing their fixed price menu and when the bill came, they did not deduct the discount as it apparently only applied to their regular menu. So with 2 soft drinks (â‚¬6.50 per glass), cover charge (â‚¬2 each) and service charge, our â‚¬15 fixed price menu turned into a â‚¬53 bill. We were sad to leave the hotel. The staff was incredible (none of them were milling around waiting for tips as we've found elsewhere), the location was perfect being a couple of bridges (5 mins walk) to San Marco square and the atmosphere was luxuriously intimate (unlike Hotel Danieli which seemed more of a high end business hotel when we went in for dinner). Definitely recommend for couples on a romantic break.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, worth the price”
Reviews.Author: MrsBee711
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked in to stay at this hotel (we weren't bumped from another hotel like other reviewers). It was by far the most amazing hotel during our honeymoon. We didn't feel harassed to go to the glass factory, but they did mention it. The staff was extremely helpful and nice. No, it wasn't cheap, but for our very short stay, it was the perfect location (less than 5 minutes from Piazza San Marco). We also ate at the hotel restaurant (you get a discount if you're staying there) for dinner our first night and the food was amazing. The breakfast they offer also does not leave you wanting.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: shabs04
Reviews.Content: A friend recommended this hotel, altough she did advise that the rooms were slightly on the small side. I decided to book this hotel as it is right opposite the water taxi stop and therefore I wouldn't need carry my luggage around the narrow streets and as I had a 6 month old baby with me, this worked out to be very convenient. I was pleasantly surprised when we were given one of the larger room (this could be due to us needing a cot in the room), the room was lovely. we were looking out onto the main street, although you could hear the tourists and streetgoers it didnt really bother us too much. The breakfast was included and was nice and fresh, the staff were really helpful and polite. We did eat in the hotel restaurant a couple of times, the food was nice although not much of a variety. The hotel is right nest to St Marks Square and as mentioned before right opposite the water taxi stop therfore convenient if you want to hop on and of different stops. I would definately recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel, fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: catlover34
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated right next to to St Marks square and Doges Palace which are both amazing and a must to visit. When you step out of the hotel the water buses, water taxis and Gondalas are right in front of you so access to other areas of Venice is easy. The hotel is only small but beautifully decorated and the breakfast was good with plenty of selection. Our evening meals were part of our package, this was useful as it kept the cost down whilst we were there but the choice was very limited and was the same choice on both nights. However when we asked we were given the choice of something else, this might depend on the waiter. Our room overlooked a side passage but this wasn't a problem as we didn't spend much time in it as there was so much to see and do, also the lighting in the room was not very bright but this made it very cosy. The hotels and bars nearby are expensive and you pay a lot more to eat and drink in St Marks Square, however there are plenty of places down the little streets where you can get cheap, decent snacks. It is worthwhile having a drink at the hotel and sitting outside watching the world go by. A trip to Murano to see the glass blowing is worthwhile. We went on a free trip by water taxi (yes it was really free!) - just be ready for the hard sell when you get there but I would definately recommend it for the ride on the water taxi which can be expensive. We also went up to the top of the bell tower in St Marks square, it cost Â£8 and you go in a lift- the views are spectacular. A trip on a gondala is worth it even tho' again its expensive, it can be cheaper if you can share with someone - they take upto 6 people but we couldn't find anyone at the time who wanted to share. Venice is a fabulous place and like no where else we have been, well worth a visit, just be prepared to do lots of walking and don't expect it to be cheap!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but noisy/busy surroundings”
Reviews.Author: herculesgal
Reviews.Content: Being our first time in Venice, we wanted a hotel that was easily accessible to the vaporettos since we didn't want to be carrying around luggage lost through the canals. This hotel is pretty easy to find since it's on a main street near St. Mark's Square. The vaporettos are right in front. The only problem is that in the mornings and at night is very noisy because the souvenir vendors roll their kiosks in and out through the streets and the side street of this hotel being one of them. The hotel room was really nice but it was small and it only had a shower, no bathtub. But I think hotel rooms in Venice are really small. Venice was also the most expensive place we stayed at in Italy having been to Rome and Florence. Venice was the only place that didn't have breakfast included with the room. However, it included a trip to the Murano Glass Factory but the catch was that to get back we were to use public transportation. So they got us to the factory to buy things and we had to find our way back possibly carrying glass stuff back? Needless to say we skipped the glass factory which we weren't interested in anyway. Not sure if this another Venice quality but at the hotel we felt like we were being nickel and dimed because when we checked in, we had a person show us to the room plus a porter to bring up our luggage so of course we had to tip both. We didn't feel we needed two people to show us up to our room.

Reviews.Title: “stayed here for wedding”
Reviews.Author: urethane
Reviews.Content: loved it! great service!!! breakfast was always delicious and the room was gorgeous!

Reviews.Title: “Another upgrade to fill inferior rooms”
Reviews.Author: bunny19
Reviews.Content: As yet another customer upgraded from the Villa Igea (round the corner) it occurs to me that this policy is being used to fill the less desirable rooms at this hotel. The 'upgraded' customers are pleased with the location and 4* services so don't complain. It also helps keep the conspicuous waterfront restaurant full. Call me a cynic, but our room was smaller than the standard room pictured on the Expedia website for Villa Igea. The bathroom was past its best and there was a large patch of mildew on the bathroom ceiling, the aircon was noisy and sound insulation sufficiently poor that the neighbouring guest could be heard snoring over the rattling aircon. The room overlooked a brick wall. Did we complain? No, we'd fallen for it; we'd been upgraded so, like others, happy with the perfect location, excellent breakfast service with friendly waiters, outstanding weekday desk staff and high standard of cleaning, we simply boast to our family and friends about having been upgraded after already getting an excellent rate for the 3* sister hotel. If you book this hotel, money probably isn't a consideration but, if it is, don't book a standard room here. Choose a well-reviewed 2 or 3* hotel instead. If it's Villa Igea, decide beforehand whether you are happy to be upgraded to this hotel only a few steps away.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, friendly staff and great value”
Reviews.Author: Mayanqueen17
Reviews.Content: I originally booked at the Hotel Igea but was told upon arrival l'd been upgraded to the 4 star sister hotel Savoia & Jolanda. The hotel is within a stones throw of the San Zaccaria water bus stop which made travel to and from the airport incredibly easy as l didn't have to drag my luggage very far (the walk was about 60 seconds!). The central location is perfect for visiting all the major attractions whether by foot or waterbus. As a lone female traveller l felt very safe in this location as its on the water front and there were always people about. The rooms are clean and suprisingly quiet for such a prime location. The staff were very helpful and courteous. Loved this hotel and would stay again if l ever got the chance.

Reviews.Title: “Exception Service”
Reviews.Author: CincyEmptynester
Reviews.Content: I arrived on Sunday June 28th after traveling for 19 days around Greece and Italy. When I went to check into the hotel and I was informed that my reservation had been cancelled by the booking agency in London. I had prepaid for this room in March and I started to panic but I was reassured that they had a triple room available and that they would help me straighten out my reservaiton on Monday. I offered my credit card but the gentleman at the front desk told me that my card was not needed. (I wish I could remember the clerks' name but all I can say is he was the friendliest and the most helpful person I have every had the pleasure of meeting.) Everytime I seemed to start worrying about the situation, the clerk kept telling me to "relax and that I was in Venice to enjoy my vacation and the business would be straighten out on Monday". Monday morning I have a very good breakfast that included bacon and eggs and a wide variety of pastries and fruits. This breakfast was included in the price of my room. Monday I went to my scheduled tour and went back to the hotel to assist them with my booking problem. When I arrived back at the hotel I was greeted by the General Manager who informed me that everything had been taken care of and that I had nothing to worry about. If this situation had occurred in an American hotel I would have had to present my charge card and at least pay for one nights stay. The triple room was a bit tight but so was every triple room that we stayed in Italy. The bathroom was large. The only thing I would say was a negative was that the shower glass swings out and the floor was wet after a shower. Otherwise I would say that this hotel was a 9.5 out of 10. The location was great, right in front of the Grand Canal at the San Laccaria stop where you could get on a water taxi or a wide variety of public transportation. We where only 3 bridges from St Mark's square which was only a few minutes walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Great Overall Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GalFromUpstateNY
Reviews.Content: We went with my family of three (my two parents and me) So we stayed in a 'triple' room so our room was slightly larger and i was glad to see that they actually had a full sized bed for the third bed, not a roll away which was the case in many hotels we stayed at. The hotel was nice, slightly dark becuase of its decorations but nice none the less. The bathroom was a good size. The staff we found was very helpfull, they had two different people come to our room with us to show us how to work things, etc. and the front desk people were helpful in terms of restaurant suggestions, maps/activities, and making arrangements. One of the nicest concierges I have seen in a while and they knew very good English. The breakfast has many options (when it comes to European-style breakfasts), however I thought slightly over prices (25 Euro), so one day we actually went around the corner to a delicious bakery and got home-made goodies. The location was amazing, you couldnt have asked for a better location if you are looking to stay near St. Marco. Its about a 3 minute walk away, yet you are far enough off the beaten path that you are not dealing with a lot of tourists, etc. Right outside the hotel is a gorgous few of the Grand Canal, and lots of street vendors, shopping, gondola rides, and taxis. One of the water buses has a stop right near the hotel, making it very convienent. The only problem we really encountered with the hotel was that they were slightly pushy to go to their Murano Glass Factory which was off the island, a quick ride by the water taxis or the water buses. They must have had some sort of agreement with that factory becuase they gave you a free ride over there, to 'show you how the glass is made and get to see some of the pieces'. The ride over there was gorgous and the little island was very nice, however, after seeing the quick presentation on how the glass was made, they then bring you into an art studio that has very expensive pieces of work (all gorgeous, but still...), and you feel very obligated to buy one. After you leave the huge sales room is there a small gallery with little things you can buy (which we did not know this, so we purchased a more expensive item). That is the only thing that I would recommend not doing, or at least be prepared to wane off the sales people (who are very good!) Other than that small thing I would very much recommend this hotel due to its kind staff, perfect location and cleanliness.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Stravelor
Reviews.Content: Nice location near St. Marks Square but hard to find and even harder to reach. Over pushy reception trying to encourage excursions to their Murano glass factory. Breakfast was small, leftover food from the previous nights dinner. Smallest, most expensive room we experienced in Italy. Room amenities were dated and shower was uncomfortable. Service was sub-par. Go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with my stay here”
Reviews.Author: Farnham_SurreySarah
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 4 night stay in Venice and was utterly delighted with this hotel. It is in a superb location right opposite the Zaccharia water taxi stop so no suitcase dragging for ages! The reception staff were superb and so friendly and helpful. Our room was quite small but does that really matter? we could get round the bed, the air conditioning worked, our shower was really powerful and every day we had fresh sheets and clean towels. We were out all day but just came back for a couple of hours at 6 and caught the news on the satellite tv stations. The breakfast buffet consists of bacon, scrambled egg, boiled eggs, ham, salami, rolls, croissant, cake, fruit salad, yogurts, toast, cheese, freshly squeezed orange juice etc.etc. masses of choices. Served until 10 every morning so you can fill up on that and have a late lunch. At first I was a bit disappointed not to have a view to the front, but in retrospect, our side room was beautifully quiet and so was in the end, quite relieved! I would return to this hotel and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: BAllison
Reviews.Content: We were here for three nights and it was a very nice hotel. The location is great and there are many nice places to eat behind the the hotel. I did not like the breakfast not enough western choices. Everything else was great.

Reviews.Title: “Old style Class and Sophistication”
Reviews.Author: auburnfemirish
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Venice alone in March, I try to manage one trip alone each year and after reading 'Miss Garnet's Angel' I headed for Venice. Venice exceeded all expections much of that was due to my stay in this Hotel. Many hotels are rated 3* 4* etc. but this hotel just exuded old style class and sophistication without being overwhelming I would not give this hotel a star rating because it exceeds all expectations ...- virtually on the waterfront next to the San Zaccaria vaporetta stop -excellent for the lone traveller. I never felt alone always someone to talk to in the hotel and throughout Venice people could not have been friendlier -Grazie Mille! Majella Ireland

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: LoveGoodHotels7
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 3 nights at start of our honeymoon. It's a fantastic location. We were in a room that was 2 flights of stairs up from the 3rd floor, so it was a bit of a treck but there was a view of the lagoon from one of the 3 windows in the room so that was nice. Breakfast was excellent - fresh fruit, good coffee, cereals, eggs, breads etc.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE”
Reviews.Author: TRAVLER-LA
Reviews.Content: The location was great and the employees were very helpful.My ronn did not have a great view but it was very beautifuly decorated.I was on the second floor facing an alley..

Reviews.Title: “wonderful”
Reviews.Author: JudyHLancs
Reviews.Content: Just back from venice and had to let you know what a great hotel this is for the price. We had clean sheets and towels everyday and 2 huge bath robes. Right on the grand canal , we ate our breakfast outside in the sunshine looking over the canal. We were just round the corner from st marks square and the palace, Water bus stop San Zaccarria right opposite the hotel, we got a 36 hr pass and visited the islands. Go to Burano jut to see the leaning tower. Dont know how it tays up. Had a realy good meal in Academia. Taverna san trovaso. well worth a visit and very reasonable. Venice is such a lovely place, enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful View & Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Cali_Gal_19
Reviews.Content: There is nothing bad to say about this hotel. Upon check in, we were offered an upgrade without having to ask. And what an incredible upgrade it was! We were given a room on the 3rd floor with a balcony that overlooked the Grand Canal! From here, we watched all the Carnivale activities. Fabulous. The staff were all accommodating and very respectful/kind. The hotel was 150 feet from St. Mark's square. Although many people opt to take the ferry bus up and down the canal, we chose to walk everywhere. It is an easy walk to sites such as the Rialto Bridge, Ca' de Oro, Peggy Gugenheim, etc. And hopping across the canal using the Traghetto for .50 euro, was a breeze.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location, and an incredible staff!”
Reviews.Author: Tornado65
Reviews.Content: We got upgraded to a room (you can see it on the front page of the website) that had a view of the canal and was just more than we could ask for. Now shower, but a jacuzzi tub more than made up for it :) Ahhhhh. The breakfast wasn't quite as good as we had in Florence or Rome...but other than that, this place was as good or better than our hotels in those two cities. Without question, this was the best staff. We had a flight dilema coming back to the states and they helped us get it all squared away and back on track..they didn't have to do that, but they did. They helped us find anything we needed, get our bus to the airport and just basically help us with things we didn't even ask for. And..hilarious on top of that :) The location was perfect ..but I wouldn't choose the ghondala (sp?) rides in front of this hotel. We had a far better deal by going to the Rialto (again, sp?) bridge. 9.9/10 on everything here..an absolute pleasure!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Cheezel
Reviews.Content: This was a great location with lots of activity outside. Our room did not have any view however our children could access a roof balcony which allowed a gorgeous expansive look over the Canal. We had a wonderful meal outside the hotel and all attractions were only a few steps away. Our stay was made even better with the wonderful service afforded by the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel”
Reviews.Author: twitsWorcestershire
Reviews.Content: I booked this trip as a surprise for my husbands 70th birthday,and we were very impressed with everything about it.The warm welcome,porterage,cleanliness,furnishings,all the staff we came into contact with were so pleasant and helpful.The breakfast was very good, so much choice, you had to try it all!Meat, cheese,cereals,breads(try the one with walnuts in, fantastic)croissants,fresh fruit salad, fresh fruit, bacon, eggs,coffee, tea,cappucino, i could go on forever, but you get the idea!You can sit outide to eat and as you are next to zaccaria water bus stop,you see the office workers arriving and know you are off for another day wandering the canals,bliss!!

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: maldivesod
Reviews.Content: The location cannot be beat. i had a side room--it was larger than i had expected--it was quiet, clean...no complaints. The staff were helpful and the breakfest buffet was quite good--again no complaints. I would stay here again...p.s. the hotel booked a water taxi for me (80 euro) and well worth the money-- very convenient and quite fun!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: PeterGW
Reviews.Content: The Savoia & Jolanda has a great location overlooking the S. Marco basin and right opposite the Isola S Giorgio. It is a two minute walk from St. Mark's Square. The waterbus stop and water taxi stand are right out front. The hotel is decorated in the appropriate Venetian style. We had a room at the side of the hotel (you pay extra for a view) but the room was comfortable. The bathroom was modern and looked relatively new. The bed linen was changed every day and on a couple of nights the beds were turned down with the customary chocolate. Only complaint was the thin walls - you could hear next door flushing their toilet. Breakfast was fine with the normal buffet selection. Staff were efficient and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location, lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Joysey
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay in this hotel - we had a great time. The location is absolutely amazing - it has a wonderful view of the lagoon with gondolas, all kinds of boats and even cruise ships travelling up and down, day and night. We had a junior suite with view of the lagoon - could have sat there for hours just watching, mesmerised. The room was large with comfortable double bed and sofa bed for our son. Television a bit old fashioned, but we didn't care. There was a mini-bar and modern bathroom with power shower. The best thing was the room had 2 door/windows, which opened onto 2 small balconies where we could sit and look at the boats - I can't rave about that enough. The hotel has a lovely old fashioned and grand air about it. Reception is full of wood panelling and the rooms are furnished in a traditional style with old furnishings and Murano glass chandeliers. Very charming and appropriate. We took a water taxi from the station - 60Euros, but worth splashing out on, as it is such a fun experience. There is also a waterbus stop just opposite the hotel. As well as the view, the hotel is very convenient for St Marks Square and for just losing yourself in the beautiful back streets and alleys of this amazing city. We had breakfast - a bit disappointing but ok, but did not eat dinner here. We thought it was a bit overpriced and touristy. Instead we found little restaurants on the backstreets off the beaten track and had the most wonderful meals. The hotel is expensive, but worth it. You pay for the views, but they are amazing and I would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “magical hotel”
Reviews.Author: tripmavenManhattan
Reviews.Content: what a beautiful place looking out onto the St giorgio magiore church island. The rooms with views are quite expensive...but venice is a precious place with very little space. the restaurant is good (especially the free breakfast)...but explore the many small trattorias, restaurants, and pannini bars..for much better though. the best value compared to cipriani, hilton danelli etc...would highly recommend

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful View and Convienent Location”
Reviews.Author: msc78
Reviews.Content: Venice was the first stop of our two week honeymoon and this hotel was the best. The staff was friendly and very helpful with both directions and food recommendations. The hotel is located directly across from the water bus that brings you from the airport so you only have to drag your luggage a few hundred feet. It is also located just around the corner from St. Mark's Square. The room was decorated beautifully. Full of lush fabrics and amazing Murano glass light fixtures. We were upgraded to a suite that overlooked the lagoon because our standard room wasn't ready when we got there. It was much larger than any other room we had in Italy. Our favorite thing was the coffee. I have no idea how they brew it or what kind it is but it was amazing. I would go back in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: JCSBrighton
Reviews.Content: Before travelling I emailed to hotel to find out what time check in was (2pm), as we had an early flight. By the time we'd has a coffee, waited for a water bus and done the hour long trip to Venice from the Airport we weren't that early! On arrival at mid-day the really helpful and friendly man on reception said they'd got our room ready as they knew we were arriving early, hurray for my email (top future tip for all travellers)! Throughout our stay the reception staff were very friendly, and at check our they held our bags for us. Yes, by American standards our room was small (but larger than the one I had in NY!), but perfectly normal size for European rooms. There was a large comfy bed, small TV, minibar and the bathroom had an actual bath as well as a shower, lovely robes etc. We had a small balcony on the side of the hotel overlooking the Danielli Hotel. The room was clean and well presented. The hotel location is what sells it, 4 buildings along from the Doges palace, throughout our stay we spotted loads of poor folks dragging suitcases up and over bridges,clutching maps and looking really unhappy - not for us. Straight along from St Marks waterbus stop, 5 mins max past loads of tourists by the bridge of sighs. The restaurant at the hotel is lovely, the service was not hurried but set to our pace, and friendly staff, plus 20% off for residents. Breakfast was better than the usual continental with the addition of scrambled eggs and pancetta, which really set me up for a day of walking. Weather bitterly cold and dry for a couple of days, cool and damp for the other 2. Along with comfy foot wear take a plastic mac and a warm hat!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: tigerpaw83
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very conveniently located from the San Marco stop and faces the Grand Canal. The staff were not necessarily friendly, but they were not rude either. They were helpful in giving us information and directions as well as storing our luggage after checkout so we could explore a bit before our scheduled time of departure. We were pleasantly surprised when we returned after dinner to find turn down service and chocolates on our pillows :-)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Intrepid_Traveler13
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a very good location. It was a very easy walk from the San Marco stop of the water bus, plus well located for many of the great sights such as Piazza San Marco, and the Bridge of Sighs. It' is a very easy walk to other sights of interest as well. The hotel provided free breakfast that was plentiful, however it seemed salty to me. Even the orange juice. Pros: -lush bathrobes -free breakfast -good location -heated towel rack Cons: -some mildew and rust in the bathroom -microscopically small elevator -no computer room, fee for internet usage

Reviews.Title: “Good and Bad Experience”
Reviews.Author: racerchick
Reviews.Content: I would say the good and bad average out to an "ok" stay. I arrived one hour before official check in and was told there was no way to check in early. On a good note they stowed my luggage while I wandered around in a jet-lagged state for an hour. The front desk staff were reasonably helpful but certainly not above average. I travel a great deal and would not give this hotel an outstanding rating for front desk service. I did not see the "upgraded" rooms mentioned in earlier reviews but I'm sure they are fabulous. Mine was very small but well set up. There were no instructions for the TV so I relied on fellow travellers to tell me how to get CNN and BBC. My room "overlooked" the alley and you could almost touch the next building. No big deal in November since the windows could be closed but even leaving them open a slight bit meant sharing the very early morning delivery activities for the normal commerce. It didn't bother me in the least since it added to the experience and I was up very early anyway. I wish however that there was an in-room coffee maker since the restaurant only opened at 7AM. Note regarding the internet: it's extremely expensive and is sold by the hour. Only on my last day, after several complaints, did they add a hand-out with instructions to properly disconnect after using less than the time you paid for. This would have saved me a lot of money. The restaurant staff were amazing! A few nights I dined on my own and they were incredibly gracious. They sent my desert fruit and wine up to my room to enjoy later. I was on a photography course with 15 others and on 2 nights we had group dinners at the hotel restaurant. These were both amazing in terms of the food (hot and delicious) and service - top notch. I'm not saying stay here for dinner instead of venturing out and exploring, but if you're beat and want to chill close to your room, you won't be disappointed. Also, the breakfast buffet is small by some standards but more than adequate to get you going. Lots of fruit, breads and cereals in addition to the usual eggs and bacon and the coffee is just fantastic. I'm not sure how to evalutate the price of this hotel. Firstly I don't know exactly how much we paid since it was included in my overall trip. Secondly I think there is a real value to the location. From the front steps of this hotel you can walk to the Piazza San Marco within minutes, the vaporetto stop is steps away, and the people watching from the hotels own cafe is second to none. Yes, a coffee will cost you $7.00 US but the atmosphere and service are outstanding. As a seasoned traveller I would say that this hotel is best for people who want a convenient location both to arrive and depart but also to explore Venice. My pesonal opinion is that this hotel takes some liberties with respect to front desk service because of the location. The restaurant staff make up for it in a big way. Overall I would recommend this hotel. Hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful View and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: FuninPhx71
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Savoia & Jolanda Hotel for 3 nights and we had a great time. We were upgraded to a junior suite overlooking the water, looking right at the Basilica San Gregorio and the Basilica Maria della Salute. It was especially fun to see the huge cruise ships pass by the window. The rooms was huge, but it was a suite, and I'm sure it was not indicative of most rooms. The view was unparalleled. The bathroom was spacious and the decoration was beautiful. It is a bit noisy outside, the hotel is a two-minute walk to St. Mark's and there are a lot of people, also, there is a Vaporetto stop right outside the hotel. Late at night, we could hear people down on the street having a good time. The breakfast was typical of the Italian breakfasts and offered the rolls and desserts from the restaurant the night before, along with eggs and the lunchmeats. The restaurant in the hotel was very nice and we had a delicious dinner there on the first night. The location was terrific, we were right next to the Bridge of Sighs and the Piazza and we could take the water taxi anywhere from our front door. I would definitely recommend the Savoia & Jolanda Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: dippyclaire
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the start of our honeymoon in Venice. Although we had a fairly small room with a view of a brick wall the decoration and furnishing were to a high standard. Breakfast was served on the Grand Canal and there was a good choice. The location was brilliant, just 3 minutes walk from St. Mark's Square and opposite a Vaporetto stop. Staff were very friendly. A great base to explore Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, central, a bit expensive for what you get”
Reviews.Author: arf9999
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right where they say it is, very near to Piazza San Marco. That's good... and bad. Good because it is a 2 minute walk to the Doge's Palaces, San Marco Basilica, and St Mark's Square. Bad because there are MILLIONS of tourists clogging up every available space in the vicinity. That's not the hotel's fault though. The hotel was, like everything in Venice, very expensive. It is rated as a four star, and the staff were pleasant, the room clean (if a bit cramped with the extra bed for my child), and the bathroom modern. The air conditioning worked well (it was very hot in Venice in July) Our room did not face the lagoon, but evidently there are some rooms that do. The breakfast that was included in the room rate was satisfactory, on a par with most Italian hotels, but not as good as I would expect in a four star hotel in most other countries. If you want a hotel that is secure, clean, and easy to find (this can be an issue in Venice) then I can recommend this one. I personally wouldn't rate it a four star hotel, but maybe a very good three star.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Betrog
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located on the Grand Canal at the San Zacchiara vaporetto stop. It is a short walk to St Marks Square which makes for a lovely evening stroll with orchestras playing in the square. It is an easy walk to the Rialto Bridge just follow the signs.. Hotel occupants are given a 20% discount at the restaurant which has both inside and outside dining. the breakfast Buffet is quite adequate..rolls and croissants , cereal, fruit, meats,yogurt, and coffee and tea. The reception staff were friendly and helpful. 3 of us shared a room which was fine...clean and attractive. We did not have a canal front room...cost!!!! We had an early departure 7 AM so we were given a breakfast to go which included juice,apple, banana, packaged bread and several other items which we ate at the airport. My second stay at S & J. Hotel Villa Igea an annex directly behind S & J and owned byS & J is a great location less expensive and has similar breakfast included. Rooms..attractive and may stay there my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Katya525
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from a fantastic trip to Italy. It was my first time and my husbands' second. I booked the entire trip myself and was a bit nervous about this hotel because we have always stayed in 5 stars . I initially found this hotel in Frommers guide at the library. I then read all of your reviews and started the process. I called the hotel and they were very helpful from the start. I am so picky, my husband is not. I asked a lot of specific questions about the room, the view and the amenities. I was torn because all of my friends had stayed at the famous Danielli hotel which by the way is right next door to this hotel. I booked room # 304 with the suggestion of the wonderful concierge. I also by the way booked a room at the Danielli with no view for more money.. I went back and forth with the 2 bookings and at the end cancelled the Danielli and went for the Savoia & Jolanda was I glad!! We had a room that had 3 floor to ceiling windows with walk out balconies with a perfect view of the small canal! The room was large, clean and had a huge bathroom with jaccuzzi tub and shower. The staff was so nice without being obnoxious! The breakfast was very good and abundant with tables that sat right outside overlooking the water. I am so happy that all I read in your reviews and also frommers was right on target. We did have a junior suite, but it was half as much as I would have paid at the Danielli for much less of a view and probobly a smaller room! All in all this was a great place to stay and I will return.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, but no view”
Reviews.Author: borahorza
Reviews.Content: We got a very good deal for this hotel through a hotel booking website and it was well worth it. The hotel was very nice, with the staff being very friendly and helpful. The room itself was small in comparison to rooms in other cities but I have heard that rooms in most hotels in Venice are fairly small. Unfortunately there was no view from the room, even though the hotel sits on the edge of island overlooking the water. The room was very clean, and well kept by house keeping aswell. Venice was very cold, but dry, and we could see that they had just cleared away all the boardwalks from the wet season! One thing to point out about Venice is that gondola rides are not cheap!

Reviews.Title: “first class”
Reviews.Author: nptonorient
Reviews.Content: just come back from staying in this hotel for my wifes 40th and carnevale, the hotel just made the stay better the service was first class,the position was brilliant, right outside is canal and couple of minutes walk and you where at all the main sights. shame did not have room with a view but we had courtyard area,i would use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay for a November honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Caddy5Jersey
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel through Tripadvisor reviews, and we had a perfect honeymoon together here. The location, staff, excellent breakfast in the main hotel round the corner, all contributed to a truly memorable and happy stay. The rooms were clean, newly refurbished and excellent value - bathroom was a major plus. Overall excellent value and lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location!!”
Reviews.Author: dannafromcalgary
Reviews.Content: This property is located literally across from the water taxi stop, and a 2minute walk to St Mark's square. The breakfast was delicious, fresh and had many options to choose from. The rooms are on the small side, but we don't spend that much time in the rooms when we are travelling anyways. The rooms were very clean and comfortable. Bathroom was also nice and clean, and you could stand up to shower in the tub. There are rooms available for a higher price to view the canals. We did actually take the free shuttle to Mirano and had a wonderful day there. We are from Canada, and we easily drank the water from the public water fountains - There was not a coffee machine in the room which would have been nice. The cafes on the main front were quite expensive, but we prefer to meet the locals and walk more into the residential areas. We had arranged tours to see St. Mark's Square, Bridge of Sighs...worth the tour to understand the history better. Overall, I am generally a 5* person in North America and I feel very comfortable recommending this property to any traveller. Bon Voyage!! questions? feel free to e-mail me danna@shaw.ca

Reviews.Title: “Beware when booking!”
Reviews.Author: JaviCAP
Reviews.Content: The staff is not honest. We sent the "Booking form" their website asking for the Suite with lagoon view. Five minutes after, we received a mail from the hotel telling "Your booking has been accepted. Please follow this link to give us your cc details and secure the room" Some other words, and finally a note : "We are able to offer you a Junior Suite with Lagoon view at daily Euro 320,00 euro"..... I was confused, and mailed back them, telling I was asking for the suite, and they seemed to be offering a Junior suite, and so, if they could clarify about. Half an hour later, received another mail, explaining, that they were offering a standard junior suite at 320 euro because the suite was booked, but that they can offer too a de luxe junior suite for 370 euro per day. The fact, is that in many websites, this room, the "de luxe junior suite", was offered at 340 euros for the same period. I don't use to look for the penny, but it all seemed to me a ripoff, to offer the same room for the same dates for 120 euros more total amount, and saving the comision they use to be charged for the booking sites. I mailed back once again asking if they had availability for more de luxe junior suites, and answered that this 370 euros per night was the only de luxe available, so it was the same room offered in Venere or Bookings. Not honest at all.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointing stay at the Savoia and Jolanda”
Reviews.Author: Italyisthebest
Reviews.Content: We selected a four star hotel because we expected upgraded rooms with reasonable space, views and cleanliness. The hotel Savoia and Jolanda was a total disappointment in all three categories. In fact, there appear to be relatively few rooms wih a view of anything but the wall of the adjoining building a few feet away. The rooms were small and the pictures are misleading online. Our first room was so small that there was less than two feet to walk in front of the bed or to the sides of the bed. There was no dresser in the room, just a writing desk which had the bar/refrigerator and food for sale in the limited space available. Since space was so tight the chair to the desk was positioned in the corner of the room. There were a few small drawers in a closet which was covered by a drape, but certainly insufficient space for two travellers. When we obected to the room, the hotel management had a bus boy parade us around to several equally unacceptable rooms, so with a promise to move us to a 'better' room after their busy weekend, we decided to stay in the first tiny room as that was were our luggage was taken. Two days later, the story didn't get any better. In fact, it got much worse. But by this time we had made up our minds that this hotel was so poorly run and they had no intention to do right by us that we just gave up. But we did resolve to tell Hotels-- and to list our experience for the benefit of others. We also took pictures because we thought no one would believe the poor condition of a supposed four star hotel. To that end, our second room was indeed larger so I did not have to draw my legs in to let my wife pass to the bathroom. It wasn't spacious, but it was acceptable space, however it too had the same wall view with dark windows and no direct sunlight for the remainer of our six day stay. But the worst experience was in the bathroom, which was filthy with mildew in most of the corners and constant flow of water out of the tub. Whenever we used it, there was a large puddle that covered much of the bathroom floor. In addition, it leaked on the outside of the room and the maids must have noticed the wallpaper was crumbling so they kept a service cart parked in front of the wall outside our room to hide the soiling. The air conditioning worked poorly and each evening we would return home to find the air cut back by the maintenance staff, so we would spend the first few hours coaxing whatever air we could get out of the A/C unit which was sparing at best. We attempted to escape to the lobby to read the dailiy papers only to find that they didn't come every day which seemed to fit the expectations one would have in staying there. We will note on the positive side that the food and service in the restaurant and for the complimentary breakfast was good. A final note about the courtyard view, we suspect that there are really very few true courtyard views. We note in their write-up a few rooms have a water view and the alternative was a courtyard view. Be prepared, if you stick your head outside of the window and look in both directions you may catch a glimpse. We will not entertain staying in this hotel again. There are too many genuinely good hotels from which to choose.

Reviews.Title: “Little Gem”
Reviews.Author: BlueBaby40
Reviews.Content: I looked forward to my stay at the Savoia & Jolanda, which has been the subject of many favourable reviews here. Arriving on a late flight (which I had already advised the Hotel), I had a problem at the airport. My visit coincided with the feast of Redentore and the canal around San Marco was closed. This meant getting off at Arsenale and what I was advised would be a 15 minute schlepp. Happily, it's more like 10 minutes at a gentle pace (all that was possible at 12.45am on a Riva as crowded as Oxford Street on a Saturday afternoon, with everyone out watching the fireworks). Finally reaching the hotel I received a warm welcome to my (very bad) Italian. When asking for a smoking room my request was received with surprise - "oh you can smoke in your room" - and on asking Alberto if he required a credit card guarantee - "oh no, you pay us when you leave". A bit different from Britain! The room was a small inside single, no view, but deliciously airconditioned. The bed was rather amazing, comprising as it did a typical Venetian couch made up as a bed, with lovely matching bolster and pillows. There was thoughtful provision of extra pillow and blanket beneath the wardrobe, which also contained a minibar suitable for keeping your own drinks for. There was also a selection of snacks. I was lucky enough to have a bath as well as a shower, and there was the usual excellent Italian linen towels as well as the more usual fluffy variety. The one aspect in which I was disappointed in the hotel was breakfast. Yes, there is egg and bacon available, but it didn't look great and I was also surprised to see cake at breakfast (and on the third day the sinister thought suggested itself that they might be left overs from desert at dinner the previous night.) The toaster for bread is also rubbish, and only water and tomato juice are available, no fruit juice. Dinner in the restaurant is good though, and there's 25% discount for guests at the hotel, probably a good job given the price, but the terrace has a beautiful view of San Giggiore and towards Santa Maria della Salute. Breakfast is also taken there in fine weather. Charming staff and proximity to the vaporetti (the stops are immediately outside the hotel) make this an ideal base for exploring this beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 2 nights at the Savoia Jolanda from June 1 to June 3. We loved the hotel. The staff is very professional, the rooms are very nice and well furnished, the location is great, buffet breakfast was very, very good. We highly recommend Savoia Jolanda, we would definitely reserve there if we go back to Venice (I hope!).

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and location”
Reviews.Author: Cayman1112
Reviews.Content: We booked two rooms at the hotel. When we arrived the manager took us to the suite on the second floor. It was two bedroom suite , It had two balconies that faced the canal and it saved us 200.00 EU per night. Breakfast was included in the price and we found it comparable to other hotels. We ate dinner at the hotel one night and found it very good and you recieve a 25% discount if you are staying at the hotel. The water taxi, and gondola's are right out front. You can get to anywhere in no time at all. Everthing is close proximity for walking to. Venice is easy to get lost in until you spend some time there. Be sure and hit the farmers market on the weekend, it is ausome. Also ask the front desk for a free water taxi to Murano to visit the glass factories.

Reviews.Title: “Dont buy a Coke in the restaurant”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff, Roberto, was very helpful and effiecient. Room was comfortable and clean, however no view of the canal. Restaurant food was poor. Get better Italian food in New Jersey. Coke cost 6 euros a can.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When we arrived to the room, you could not breathe and the room was so hot. So we inquired if we could turn the air on (mind you this in middle of May) and we were told that the air does not get turned on in the hotel for two more weeks. We proceeded to open the window, but found out shortly after that it's Venice and the bugs are rampid. Within minutes we had about ten flies in the room. Needless to say, we did not sleep well and were terribly dissappointed with the room. The room was tiny, overpriced, and just an overall flop.

Reviews.Title: “We did hours of reseach before selecting this wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When deciding to visit venice, we knew we wanted a few special things. We wanted a lagoon (canal) view hotel room and we wanted a clean, high quality room for the best possible price. We decided to spring for the Jr Suite which was not what I would call cheap, but after comparing rates with other hotels I would say the rate was more definitely fair. I would expect this hotel to rate as a 4 star hotel. The room was beautiful and the view stunning. The marble bathroom was very large with a huge jacuzzi tub. The fixtures, lighting, sheets and other furnishings were all top notch. The elevator was small but charming with its either corner opening doors and large mirror. The concierge was very helpful and kind. I accidentally left my purse in the water taxi who brought us from the train station and as you could imagine I feared it was probably lost forever. When I alerted the front desk, Antonio said he would call the driver immediately and said he was a friend of his. Because he had hired a friend to pick us up, I was relieved to know that the purse was fine and he personally delivered it within an hour. The Hotel Savoia & Jolanda is between the Danneli & Hotel Londra Palace. I had no idea all these hotels were so close to eachother. When I booked I wished I had access to a map outlining the location of each hotel of interest. I reccomend finding a nice location close to St. Marks Square. The hotel Savoia & Jolanda was perfect. Not only was it only 3 minutes to St. Marks, but it was right next to the major water taxi stop and the central posh shopping areas. All in all, they take good care of you here. I would say though, avoid buying cappuccinos at the restaurant attached to the hotel. They are way overpriced and not very tasty to boot. If you venture into the interior of venice just behind the hotel there is a charming dessert shop and bar that serves the best ones for half the price of the hotel. Go check it out. I am posting photos of my trip at flickr dot com and you can search there with the keywords: jenredstar I will be making a photo gallery for my whole trip and the photos of venice will be in there somewhere. Good luck.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Birmingham_UKSue
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here twice in the last two years, most recently 2nd-5th of this month. Excellent central location, helpful and friendly staff, great breakfasts. Dinner in the restaurant a little too expensive for my purse, even with the discount for hotel guests, but numerous cheap and pleasant eating places very close by. The hotel is spotless and the rooms comfortable. Note however, that the double room we had this year (Room 214) was considerably smaller than the room we had two years ago and our bathroom only had a shower instead of the lovely big bath we had on our previous visit. So no long hot soaks after a hard day's sightseeing! This would not deter me using this hotel again, however, as the tiny room was only a small drawback and every other aspect of the hotel is outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: louisebaker123
Reviews.Content: Just returned from this hotel after a weekend break all I can say is that this is a fab hotel, fab location, and all great value for money! The hotel is right on the lagoon front with restaurants and the vapporetto stop there also. The rooms are fab, very luxurious, rustic, cleaned thoroughly and turned down daily. Could not check in until 2pm so hotel looked after our bags and check out time is 12 noon. Ate in the restaurant there, using our 25pc discount off, very expensive still, but lovely for the 'one off' special meal. (approx cost 4 people 200 euros). The hotel is 2 mins away from st marks square, doges palace and numerous restaurants!! I would also recommend you purchase a pass to use the vapporettos during your stay, which also covers the airport transfer bus/boat, very easy to get from the airport too, takes about 1.5 hours. Would thoroughly recommend!!

Reviews.Title: “will definitely return”
Reviews.Author: wandererNorthwales
Reviews.Content: Four of us stayed here for the last two days of Carnival. We had booked through one of the web sites and would thoroughly recommend the hotel for location and value for money. We had a slight delay booking in as arrived at 12 noon, our room was located on the first floor and we had a side view of the lagoon. We ate lunch at the hotel and soaked up the atmosphere and view. The food at this hotel is delicious with 25% discount deducted from your bill NB:make sure your request this. Breakfast choice is very good, hot and cold and - surprise for italy - 'british' bacon. Location is superb,and first time visitors cannot get lost.The firework display on the last night was right outside our hotel and an early morning walk to the Doges Palace (2 minutes away)ensured wonderful pictures of the Carnival mannequins in the early sunshine with few tourists around. It is a main tourist area with numerous vaporetti stopping outside the hotel, including the boat for Murano etc, so no lugging cases long distances. We were extremely comfortable at this hotel. Staff were charming and friendly. Word of warning if you fly Ryanair and arrive at Piazzale Roma by bus. DO NOT FOLLOW DIRECTIONS GIVEN BY THE MEN GREETING YOU AT THE BUS STOP AND POINTING YOU TO THE'VAPORETTA'. THEY ARE POINTING YOU TO THE PRIVATE BOATS and inform tourists that an additional charge is applied for cases on the Vaporetta.Not true. These boats charge 10 euro SINGLE journey as opposed to the 9 euro RETURN ticket you get on the Vaporetta. We didn't fall for this, and asked a local the way, but many unsuspecting tourists were caught out.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: prospect45
Reviews.Content: Great location but the single room was TINY and dark. Breakfast was ok but queues most mornings. Staff were generally very pleasant. Decor is overly plush which must be oppressive in the heat!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Great Energy in the Heart of Everything”
Reviews.Author: ceisen1037
Reviews.Content: We were treated royally when we arrived. We were provided a bottle of wine, some commemorative prints, a complimentary lunch and breakfast each day. We were upgraded immediately to a suite which faced the Grand Canal and all of the action on the street. We were thrilled and got some great photos also. It was an amazing location with access to the water taxis, gondolos right in front of the hotel since it is at an important stop. The rooms were luxurious and the bathroom quite nice with the jacuzzi in it (since we got the upgrade). The front desk staff was very helpful and spoke English. The only thing to beware of is their special trip to the Muran Glass factory which is to a very expensive showroom. We didn't realize that Murano was an entire large area with many special showrooms where we could have bought equally beautiful and expensive glass-Beware of that trip--do that one yourself. Overall, the stay at this hotel made our trip to Venice the best city we went to on our 3 city tour of Rome, Florence, Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied Traveller”
Reviews.Author: Jack43
Reviews.Content: The Savoia & Jolanda occupies an excellent position on the Venice Bay, the hotel is spotless, rooms and bathrooms are small but are well furnished in Venetian style, crisp white linen and towels were changed daily when we were there. The breakfast buffet was very good but the tea/coffee not to our liking (we used to take our own tea bags with us). Only complaint no tea/coffee making faciities in rooms, after reading previous reviews on this subject we took our own travel kettle and tea/coffee for a welcome late afternoon/early evening cuppa after all the sight seeing. Venice overall is excellent the most romantic place i've been to, expensive but worth every penny, but take a good pair of comfortable walking shoes with you, you are going to need them (I lost count of the people I saw with plasters on their feet).

Reviews.Title: “Not up to the standard...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: of some comparable, price wise, major city hotels in Italy. We had booked a lagoon room, but were told upon arrival none were available. Big Surprise!? Our room , at no change in price mind you, was barely big enough to turn around in... and for the batroom , well one at a time please! The location is very good as is the breakfast...other wise book some where else. bfelton594@aol.com

Reviews.Title: “Winter special at Savoia & Jolanda”
Reviews.Author: kat1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Savoia & Jolanda in Novermer (low season) 2003 and 2004. The photos attached were from 2003 (you can tell because in 2004, St.Giorgio was scaffolded) and all were taken from my room. I picked this hotel on the busy Riva Schiavoni only because a room with lagoon view was garanteed by their special offer "Why Not?" which costed EUR480 for two nights incl. buffet breakfast, one a-la-carte dinner incl.wine, a bottle of prosecco in ice bucket in the room, for 2 persons. At ordinary rate, it would have been too expensive for me. The room was one of the most luxurious I had stayed of Venetian style and my travel partner and I were both satisfied. Thus, we repeated the same in 2004. The funny thing was in 2004, the rate was even lower at 420.00 though we got a slightly smaller room. At other trips to Venice, I'm perfectly happy with 3 star hotels without this magnificent lagoon view but still our room at Savoia & Jolanda is something I will always remember. One thing I cared less about this hotel is their breakfast. Kind of crumpy room and the quality of the food could be improved but for the price I paid, I don't complain.

Reviews.Title: “Take your rubber boots!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Despite being booked in the hotel, they put us in the annexe at the back: but it was a nice room and quiet, so not too much of a problem, although we obviously did not have a lagoon view. If it had been summer when the Riva Degli Schiavoni is very crowded and noisy, this would actually have been a benefit. You cannot fault the location of the hotel either, it is so central and right opposite the water taxi/bus stops. The main problem with this hotel is that the restaurant floods at high water, which led to the weird experience of eating breakfast with our feet in four inches of very cold, smelly water, and all the waiters in welly boots! Our number one top tip for visitors to Venice in the winter is to check the moon tables and the weather. The city floods more than 200 times per year and you WILL need rubber boots. The 'emergency boots' sold on the quayside for around 10E only last for a matter of an hour or so before they leak. This was our first trip to Venice and we will go back, and will probably try another hotel. Nothing major wrong with this one, but I am sure we could probably find a better one - although it might cost an arm and leg like everything else in Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: Redfern
Reviews.Content: Firstly I have to say we paid a bargain-basement price for our room. We must have had the smallest room possible and yes it was above the bins at the back. However, the room was very nicely decorated with all of the amenities that one would expect and the bathroom was bigger than others I have experienced in Venice. The staff are extremely friendly and professional. Breakfast was very good. I noted that previous guests have commented on the coffee. Well, I asked my choosy husband for his verdict and he said that it was typical of breakfast coffee in Europe. Location is key. This hotel is c.20 seconds from the San Zaccaria jetty.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel & Location”
Reviews.Author: Mandarin0
Reviews.Content: This was a nice typical Venitian hotel. Just next door to the Danieli and round the corner from Piazza San Marco. Room was slightly on the small side but it was Ok for a long weekend break. The restaurant located adjacent to the Hotel is really good plus by staying at the hotel you get 25% off your meal. Furthermore, the hotel offers are special rates around Venice plus they give all their guests a complimentary trip to the island of Murano and see a glass factory. Overall I would recommend this hotel and would definately return back here. Do not miss out on a Gondola ride even though they are expensive they are worth every penny!

Reviews.Title: “pretty good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Kriselda
Reviews.Content: I stayed here over Christmas 2004 with my husband, mother and three children. My mother had a room at the back - adequate, nicely decorated, the usual European small size. Luckily for us. they swapped our two double room (also at the back) for the Junior Suit, on condition we share with two of our children. IT WAS WORTH IT! We had 3 balconies overlooking the Grand Canal, lots of room, lots of light - just lovely. If we were to go back, I'd stay here (the location is fantastic - just a 1 minute walk from St Marks; vaporetto stop at the door) but I'd definitely go for one of the front rooms - less smell when it floods (and it did) and a beautiful aspect. Staff were friendly, restaurant fine.

Reviews.Title: “Why stay at the Danieli?”
Reviews.Author: TexasNancyL
Reviews.Content: Why stay at the Danieli when you can stay practically next-door for hundreds of Euros less? Arrive at the San Zaccaria vaporetto stop, look straight ahead, and you'll see the Savoia & Jolanda. This is a 4 Star luxury property with all the amenities, yet our junior suite cost 390 Euros per day, breakfast and taxes included - expensive, yet less than the cost of an "inside" room at the Danieli. Our two double windows (and sound-proof) overlooked the canal. Breakfast and taxes were included in the rate. Service was always helpful and professional. The downstairs Principessa Cafe offered good food, good service and moderate prices. The only drawback: air conditioning was not available Oct. 16-19, even though it was quite warm during the day.

Reviews.Title: “A honeymoon to remember”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights in January 2004 as part of our honeymoon and we loved it. We did request a balcony room as recommended on trip advisor. It was beautiful a perfect view of the grand canal. It s location was perfect three doors away from the bridge of Sighs and 200 m from St. Marks Square. The room was plush , exposed beams, tastefully decorated but a bit disappointed that there was no bath in the bathroom... and room (or suite as it was called) was small by suite standards....1 room.(Bed with a couch and table) I would highly recommend it if you wanted to splash out for a special occassion it is a bit pricey...

Reviews.Title: “Best view worst coffee”
Reviews.Author: Lemniot
Reviews.Content: This used to be a wonderful value hotel - for one reason only. It shared the best view in Venice with the Danielli next door but at a fraction of the price. The rooms were dreadful. If you had the awful luck to be in a back room with no view, you were in for a torrid time. We always paid the premium for a lagoon view. The Junior Suites upstairs are by far the best with the best view of any hotel in the World. Now everything changes. At least the price has. And it has an extra star. In fact this year's supposed refit has made little difference. The rooms are still awful, the breakfast still dire with the worst coffee and most apalling service in Venice. If you are happy with a crappy breakfast and a dark dingy room allied to a sublime balcony view then this is your best bet in Venice. For me, I am looking for somewhere else next time....those views will remain just a lingering memory. Maybe it'll be Ca Pisani or the Manin from now on?

Reviews.Title: “Charming and Elegant”
Reviews.Author: DianeBee
Reviews.Content: I was concerned about staying here after reading some of these posts. It sounded like the only happy people were in expensive suites facing the water. Well, it's true that our room was cozy and the window looked out onto a lightshaft. But is was delightfully decorated with luxurious fabrics, mirrors and lighting and a large modern bathroom. And let's face it - you don't come to Venice to sit in your room and look out the window!! We absolutely loved the location - we arrived by water taxi from the airport. Close walking distance to San Marco and right next to the Danieli. The breakfast buffet was the best we had all over Italy - and the added bonus of being able to sit outside on the terrace overlooking the venetian scenery! The desk staff was polite and spoke english. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Position,position ,position.”
Reviews.Author: MARLIN3
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel . Comfortable rooms. Helpful Staff. Great value. Next to Danieli, best position in Venice. Stayed at other hotels in Venice before which have been good but just the view from here will ensure we come back to Savoia & Jolanda.

Reviews.Title: “Best Features - Location & Price”
Reviews.Author: Royshall
Reviews.Content: The Savoia E Jolanda is a nice hotel. It does not have alot of amenities(no fitness center, limited room service, small lobby) but it has the best location, with water taxi service right out the front door, steps away from St Marks Square and excellent rates for Venice. The hotel staff was very attentive and the rooms & bathrooms were nicely adorned, although one of our rooms was rather small. If we stay there again, we would ask for larger rooms (jr suite)with a view of the canal, as their rooms come in many sizes. The hotel food is just ok, but there are many restaurant choices in Venice in close proximity to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Junior Suite”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our stay was during December 2003, and after reading reviews, we ensured to book the Junior suite at an extra cost. We searched far and wide on the internet, and found accommodation for three nights on a discount hotel site, at that same price as one night if you book directly with the hotel. Two massive windows of the junior suite overlook the Canal, and is the size of a large hotel room. Very comfortable, with a lovely large bathroom (spabath). Beautiful venetian glass chanderliers and light fittings. Very high ceilings with wooden beams. Situated right at the San Zaccharia vaperetto stop, it is just five minute walk to St Marks Square. The buffett breakfast was lovely. Staff can be a bit short, but I think this is characteristic of most Italian places, when tourists make no attempt to speak their language. We had no trouble. Would stay again for sure, and have recommended to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last year for 3 nights as a part of a trip to Italy and it was just plain awful. The staff was really rude (reoccuring theme on these reviews here) and they tried a bait and switch and stick us in the "annex", which is a nice way of saying you get a crappy room in a different building and still pay full price! What a scam, but we argued and said we would just go someplace else and contest charges on credit card, so they relented, but even then the rooms aren't that great considering what you're paying. Don't be fooled by these other positive review posters, I have no idea what they are talking about!!! Maybe hotel staff or ownership trying to balance the negative reviews or something

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Venice, but my companion had been 3 times and had stayed at the Cipriani and the Danielli. With the $ weak and my wish to split costs 50/50, we shot lower this trip. I picked Savoia based on great reviews and location (right next door to famous Danielli).We were pleasantly surprised to arrive and see that this location is totally unrivalled. We asked the friendly staffperson whether we could upgrade to a room with a balcony and canal view (we had booked at Hotels and figured that's not what we had). He showed us a regular double, which was fine, and a Jr. Suite with sea view, balcony, on 4th floor. I have stayed in many high-end hotels (through work), and I will say that this was one of the most extraordinary hotel rooms of my life. We paid a 60Euro uprade, making the room about $380 total, but it was WELL worth it. Huge room with sitting area, huge bathroom, renovated, and all with the very best view in Italy.The room is #401. It's perfect.We found the breakfast extraordinary (the reviewer detailing his 2001 breakfast is far off the mark for '04). Staff was helpful. Free shuttle to Murano -- hoping you buy stuff, but you don't have to.Gosh, we really loved this hotel and we're both very picky.

Reviews.Title: “3 years later and I am still furious!”
Reviews.Author: evening
Reviews.Content: My first 5 nights in this hotel were ok - single room was teeny, but was in main building which was fine. Sure the coffee was from a sort of vending machine, and plastic wrapped croissants were not what I expected, but dealable. But, after returning from Florence, I had one night at Savoia before my flight out - arrived at the hotel at 7pm and was put in the Annex by the extremely rude man at the front desk (I had previously read on their site that the Annex was about to undergo a drastic renovation, and my travel agent had requested I not be in it). First of all, the Annex is located off a dark alley and even this tough NYer felt a little nervous entering from the street alone. The minute I entered the annex, I was blinded by the stench of urine/worse. Went back to front desk to ask again for a room in the main building (by now it was 730pm and they had double rooms available, but would not give me one, as I was a single and they were expecting huge walk-in business after dark - yeah, right!). When I went up to the room, it reeked even more. I opened the shutters for air (there was no window, just wooden shutters) and discovered that my room overlooked the airshaft where all raw sewage flowed!
