This was October '01 and I was still using my asthma inhaler (I live 2 miles from the World Trade Center) and was up all night inhaling and gagging. The next morning, I checked out, and told the same rude guy at the front desk that I would dispute the charge for that night with American Express (I did and have not paid) and would do everything in my power to make sure the word got out about this place! The location is the only good thing about the Savoia.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in the Savoia e Jolanda in Venice from 15/2 to 18/2 as we wanted to see Venice again at Carnivale time (=very busy!). Although we were not early for check in, we did have to wait 30 minutes for the room to be prepared, but that was not a problem as there is very pleasant sitting area in the foyer. We had a very nice first floor corner 'suite' with lagoon view, but no balcony, which would have been even nicer. Nevertheless the hotel itself and our room were spotlessly clean and the beds were very comfortable. The maid turns the beds down every night and the bed linen was changed daily. The room had lots of venetian glass lights and a chandelier and is decorated in typical venetian style with real cloth 'wallpaper', paintings, a sofa, table and chairs, TV and a large mirror. Plenty of bathroom necessities were provided along with a bathrobe and even a pair of weighing scales! The only disturbance comes from outside the hotel as the Italians start their day very early and you can hear the people and vaporetti coming/going from the San Zaccaria boat stop right outside the hotel but, as with New York, it is all part of the experience. The hotel staff were helpful and pleasant. The buffet breakfast was plentiful and taken in the light and airy restaurant, but if you like your tea or coffee hot you won't get it here the water from the self service coffee machine was very luke warm, though we did ask for hotter water one day which was provided no problem. (The hottest drinks we got were in the Doges Palace Caf?.) For lunch and dinner find somewhere around town the further away from San Marco the better the prices and lower the cover charges get to Cannareggio and it falls from €3.20 to €0.75. There is a great ice cream shop if you take a 5-10 minute stroll from the hotel go left out of the front door of the hotel into the little walkway to Campo San Zaccaria and then turn left at the end and carry straight on towards St Marks Square and over a small bridge, follow the main street then the shop is where you can see the ice cream stand in the street on the right, but go into the shop and sit down for the full hit! Ice creams in a gondola shaped dish etcdelicious and NOT expensive! The vaporetto stop outside the hotel is also the one for the 82 boat across to San Giorgio Maggiore well worth the trip to go up the campanile and look back at Venice and of course the Hotel Savoia e Jolanda! We would use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Made a wonderful Birthday Present”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have just got back from Venice after surprising my mum with the trip. Even I was surprised, as the pictures on the internet looks nice but is nothing like the real thing. The interior of the hotel is so well decorated and furnished with the most lovely Italian furniture. Our room had gorgeous Venetian tapestry, with exquisite drapes with a lovely view of the canal. The room had a big chandelier which made the room even grand. We were amazed to even find a Jacuzzi in the bathroom and complimentary robes which added a nice touch to my mum's surprise. The staff were very friendly and it was situated in the perfect location to getting around the heart of Venice. I don't think I can stay anywhere but the Savoia and Jolanda Hotel if I had to return to Venice for a visit.

Reviews.Title: “we Loved it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We celebrated our 20th wedding anniversary at this hotel. We had a lagoon facing room and although the balcony was small we managed to sit out to take in the breathtaking views. Our only complaint is the sound proofing you can hear every pin drop from the next door rooms. From reading the other rwviews it seems that having a lagoon facing room makes all the difference to your stay. We would return.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected suprise”
Reviews.Author: Rad
Reviews.Content: I booked my room in June 2003 and when I arrived in September,2003 they couln't find my reservation. I had a written reservation form I presented but they said it wasn't in their computer. They did find us a room in their annex but it was not what I booked and there was no adjustment made to the bill. The room and bathroom were small but it was very clean. It was disappointing to have this happen as this was our spluge hotel of the trip to Italy. Some of the staff was very helpful while others weren't as nice.
